reviews.text: After a uneventful experience at another CCF, I will give this location / experience a better review.  The crab cake bites and tacquitos were good.  One child was happy with her Mac and cheese and my other child was pleased with her flatbread pizza despite that her first order was burnt but they were smart and considerate enough to not bring it out, rectify the situation, made her a new one, brought us some complementary small Caesar salad and comped the pizza off the bill.  Bravo to the manager on duty this past Saturday.  That is how you handle a snafu! We ordered cheesecakes to go and thoroughly enjoyed those!

Came here for lunch.  It was pretty busy.  The service is beyond horrible.  Waited about 45 minutes or more for our food.  Our server looked miserable and did not want to be there.  <br>Food is decent but definitely not worth the wait.<br>I would stay far far away unless they can improve the service.
Always a fam fav! Quick pit stop to get the desserts. Our all time fav is tiramisu cAke. Conveniently open late on the weekend. Complimentary bread served warm is to die for. Love to celebrate bdays.

I was expecting more!!<br>I&#39;ve heard that the Cheesecake Factory is very good, so a decided to try, <br>First of all, our server took 30 minutes to introduce himself to the table and I think he didn&#39;t even know what he was doing, he took 20 minutes to bring our drinks and the Ultimate Margarita was awful, I ordered a Fried Calamari which only had 3 calamari ring and a couple of tentacles, but it was full of breading, stuffed mushroom was okay, that only good thing was the bread he brought when we sat, even the Coke wasn&#39;t that good ( and that&#39;s almost impossible ), menu was very poor, no coming back!!

Been to many CFs all over the country. Usually a decent experience. Even during prime times, 15 minutes tops for cake takeout. This one is the slowest ever. 50 minutes to takeout 2 slices of cheesecake. How is that ever acceptable? <br><br>If delays are that long, they should let customers know before they place your order as some people may not want to lose an hour of their life waiting for two slices of cake that, at 1000 calories a slice, they then have to put two hours in the gym later on to burn off.

One of my better Cheesecake Factory experiences in NJ. I would definitely come to this one again. <br><br>I went on a Thursday night and they were pretty busy, so I could understand a 15 min wait for just myself. <br><br>I was seated in one of the tables at the bar, I&#39;ve always been a little skeptical about service in bar areas bc I assume the bartenders would be too busy making drinks. But luckily they had a few more servers up there. <br><br>I was also brought out bread which is nice. The last time I went to cheesecake I was by myself so I guess the server assumed I wasn&#39;t going to eat the bread by myself? . I had to ask last time- diff location. <br><br>I ordered my usual Renee&#39;s special. It was pretty good. The soup came out hot. Usually it&#39;ll come out luke-warm at other locations. Also a lot of other places will forget the soup spoon. <br><br>My salad and turkey sandwich came out perfect too. I think this one was a Caesar, usually it&#39;s a spring mix, but that&#39;s okay, tasted pretty good:-) <br><br>The only thing I could see improvement on is timing. I feel if there was a wait, then service should be on point once seated. - the wait is usually to give servers time to catch up if the restaurant isn&#39;t at full capacity. - and my server cane to check up on me after I finished eating.

I placed an order at 3:30 today, slotting it for pickup at 7pm. When i reach the restaurant at 7:15, i was told that i have to receive a text message that the order is ready for pickup and then only can i receive it. <br>No where in the confirmation mail or at the website (while booking, after booking) was it mentioned about receiving a text message for pickup. I have travelled 10 miles in the worst rain of the season to pickup the order - just to know about a system which was mentioned no where and apparently its &#34;understood&#34; ( as quoted by the store manager)<br><br>When i called the store, i was told that there is a long list of order and my order has just been put in And its going to take time. How in the normal sense am I supposed to digest the fact that an order which was placed at 3:30 for pickup at 7- has not been pushed for preparation till 7:35??? This is heights of being taken for granted and unprofessional behavior.
Not sure this location has it figured out. They made us wait for 45 min after the given pickup time for an online order only to get it wrong.

I haven&#39;t been to this Cheesecake in years and I was truly shocked by how wayyyyyy downhill this place has gone!<br><br>*Extremely slow service. It literally took over 25 minutes to just get water....<br>*Super small portions! I know Cheesecake is known for its giant meals but these weren&#39;t even regular-sized. The food looked sloppy and as if whoever prepared it could not care less about the job....<br>*Most of the employees looked legitimately annoyed and angry to be there, or that they were simply there to hang out.<br><br>I will not be returning to that location....

Cheesecake delivers reasonably priced food with huge portions. In short, diner food with upgraded ambiance with emphasis on desserts. Their menu is huge. It has everything. They now have skinny menus that compile items that have comparatively less calories for people who are health conscious. <br><br>Their drinks are awesome too. Apple martini, sangria are 2 cocktails I get the most. Also, mango smoothie type of drink is fantastic. For appetizers, eggrolls, nachos and spinach dip are excellent to share. Their salads are pretty fresh too with a lot of ingredients and pasta is what I usually get the most. Louisiana pasta used to be better with more sauce but the portion seems to be even larger than before.<br><br>Desserts! Can&#39;t really go wrong with any cheesecake here. Tiramisu, chocolate mousse and of course the strawberry cheesecakes are among the most popular ones. There&#39;s always room for desserts!

My girlfriend and I came here on Thursday, November 1, 2018 for a last minute date night. We arrived to Cheesecake Factory around 7:30PM and were immediately seated upon arrival. We weren&#39;t that hungry so we only ordered an appetizer and two desserts. <br><br>As per usual, we ordered the Spinach and Artichoke Dip as an appetizer. And again, we devoured it in a few short minutes. Cheesecake Factory&#39;s Spinach and Artichoke Dip is one of our favorites. The chips are never stale and the dip is always flavorful and seems fresh also! <br><br>For Dessert we ordered the Dulce de Leche Caramel Cheesecake and the Strawberry Shortcake. This was our first time ever ordering this Cheesecake and we don&#39;t regret it! The Dulce de Leche flavor was perfect and the Caramel flavor was just right also! The combination of the two flattered each other and made the entire Cheesecake just amazing! The Strawberry Shortcake, as always, was my girlfriends favorite. And I too, have nothing to complain about. Nor do I have any suggestions to change this dessert... other than: MAKE IT BIGGER! We absolutely love the Strawberry Shortcake so much that we tend to eat it so quickly and before we know it, it&#39;s all gone. <br><br>Not only was the food amazing, but the staff were also friendly. Our waiter, who I regret to have forgotten his name, was awesome. He continuously checked on our table to make sure we were okay. I definitely recommend coming to Cheesecake Factory during the week night because the service was a lot better than when we come on a weekend night. I rated this 4 out of 5 stars because it&#39;s not always that the service was as good as this days. And again, I think it&#39;s because this was a week day night.

I will NEVER set foot in this location again. I came here twice in one day never got the opportunity to eat. Came when they first opened with a child so l was pressed for time. My Cajun jambalaya comes out with over cooked noodles. No time to reorder so we left. <br><br>Second time at 5:00 greeted and sat by a Manager with the same child. This time we weren&#39;t in such a hurry however l sat there for 19 Minutes!!!! Not one person came to the table. I got up and told the manager as l left about the lousy experience and left. Won&#39;t waste my time again

Was here today for dinner around 8:30 PM - ordered the chicken and shrimp gumbo.  The order took so long that we had 3 servings of bread. When my order came, i could already tell that the rice was extremely raw. Had a bite and it was so raw it was crunchy. Told the server, no apology, no comment just took the plate back. She came back maybe 5-10 minutes later, still didn&#39;t say a word just handed me the gumbo. I could tell they either popped into the microwave or some heating thing or scooped out the rice from the same plate and just dumped another serving. Crunchy lumps of rice were still in the gumbo itself and the &#34;new&#34; rice was still undercooked. Server came back 10-15 mins later to finally ask how it is and i said the rice was still raw but i was so hungry i had no choice.  Smiled and left.  So disappointed in the service and the food.

Their takeout service is ATROCIOUS! Tonight was the final straw. This was their idea of chicken nachos. NO CHEESE. NO CHICKEN. NO CHILI SAUCE. Just a side a sour cream and a side of pico. NO GUAC. These are literally dry tortilla chips to dip into the sour cream and pico. I ordered through Door Dash and they&#39;re just as guilty for not checking the order before walking away, despite my having warned them as such (see my order below). I&#39;d say every other order from Cheesecake Factory in Short Hills through Door Dash is wrong. One time, I ordered taquitos and got cheeseburger egg rolls. They almost always get the nachos wrong. I blame both of them. No more ordering from this Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;m DONE with Door Dash. I&#39;m sticking with Uber Eats who has YET to get my order wrong<br><br>Update: so I am back here again but this time I didn&#39;t use delivery service. This time, I ordered the food on the site and am here to pick it up. They are making me wait on the line of 15 people who have yet to order their food even though my food is already paid for and sitting on the counter getting cold. The person at the front desk who takes the names for seating refused to help me. This place sucks.

My family and I came for dinner (instead of cooking at home). Usually, the service is solid. However, it took over 45 min for our entrees to arrive. We were so disappointed. <br><br>The manager stopped by our table and offered free cheesecake. That didn&#39;t leave us with a good feeling. Oh well.

This must be an anomaly in the chain.  The service is terrible and the manager is severely challenged.  For a place with $14 cocktails and big checks the service should be better.  Food comes out in stages, salad then 13 minutes later the dressing.  Salmon comes out and then a 15 minute wait for potatoes.  Are you kidding.  I&#39;ve been eating in Cheesecake Factory restaurants for over 25 years in at least 10 different locations and this one stands out for being poorly run and barely managed.  I am officially down with the short hills location.  <br><br>Too expensive for such crappy service.

appareling, the location has a totally different pickup instruction from the website, and of course they don&#39;t tell you. waited and waited and waited and wondered where was my pickup. called them and they told you you needed to do this instead of what the website and the email told you. Great. Thx.

The first Cheesecake Factory I was ever at was in Coconut Grove, Florida twenty years ago and they set the bar pretty damn high. (This mall is not what it used to be. Lots of high quality restaurants like Joes American Bar and Grill and Papa Razzi are no more.) The menu at this place is extraordinary. I also appreciate that they list calories next to every item on the menu. The price is average and portions are large. Every time I have had the cheesecake it has been amazing. Now for the bad news: yesterday, I came with my mom for lunch and the wait was insane. After a half hour wait, we waited another twenty minutes for our server to arrive and take our order and get us water. We knew to order everything then or we would never get our food. We shared the hamburger sliders for an appetizer and then, I had the most bland and tasteless fish tacos ever. They should have had some guacamole because I couldn&#39;t even get half way through the meal. The rice was also underseasoned. I will come back for dessert only and certainly not at this location.

When you come to any cheesecake factory there are some things you just have to expect:<br>1) wait time more than one hour after 5pm.<br>2) good cheesecake<br>3) huge variety of foods<br><br>Came here after walking around the mall.  Burgers on kids menu were good for my son.  He liked them.  I got burrito which was 90% rice; very disappointing.  I remember when these things used to be larger and filled with meat.  I guess they are training their chefs to save money and fillers to the menu items.  My wife had the enchiladas off the healthy menu and she said it was good but the side salad was not edible.  <br><br>Unfortunately i will likely be back cause there are few eating options at this mall.
Standard cheesecake factory, however the service on multiple occasions has really been sub par. I don&#39;t particularly frequent anymore because of this
Come here a few times a month. Never had a problem with the service or the food. It can get very packed on weeknight nights, so don&#39;t expect a short wait if you come with a large party.

Ordered the &#39;Fresh Vegetable Salad&#39; <br>featuring roasted beets, asparagus, green beans.<br>If there was more than one small beet, one green bean, and one slender spear of asparagus I will eat my hat. The pomegranate vinaigrette had a strong soy flavor. <br>Being seated just outside the kitchen bussing station moved this dining experience to the top of our &#39;Never to be Repeated&#39; list.

I want to share my experience with this particular The Cheesecake Factory restaurant at Short Hills. I don&#39;t recommend this restaurant to anyone because of their Unethical and disrespectful staff. I rate them zero stars due to following experiences. On 2/1, I placed a take out order online at 6 pm and arrived on time for pickup at 6:20 pm. I was in line for 45 mins just for pickup and never received my spot as people were jumping line; the problem was there was no line at all. After waiting for 50 mins I politely ask for my turn and received yelling response for cashier that I jump the line and he will not serve. I was pretty shocked and upset because after politely waiting and even though people jumping line I received this response. I requested for Manager his name is Ralph, I was disappointed as he completely didn&#39;t help and even try to solve this issue and not in condition to hear the concern. When Manager ask the cashier who is next in line the answer was &#34;I don&#39;t know&#34; this fact means that person Over the counter didn&#39;t had any idea who is next then that staff doesn&#39;t have a right to abuse saying you jump the line and will not serve you. I take this incident very seriously and going to escalate this to corporate office to this disrespectful act.<br><br>2. I also had worst dining experience in December, as usual after waiting for an hour we were given a table that was not even clean and after request to change the staff was rude as usual. The fork was not at all wash, please see the attached picture. It took 10 mins to explain what is wrong to that fork and need a wash one. We decided not to visit but gave a second chance and they fail again in Feb.<br><br>I see a major issues with management and don&#39;t have any hopes that this will ever resolve.<br><br>I had been to many Cheese cake factory this restaurant is the worst and they failed both time.<br><br>I highly recommend not to visit this restaurant till the time they fix these issues.<br><br>You lost a customer for a life. If this continues you will lose more customers.

Ok I&#39;m surprised that this place has such a low star rating..... I&#39;m staying down the street here for work, and I have now eaten here 3 times this week. <br><br>Why? <br><br>Because it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory, they are all over the country and they are ALWAYS CONSISTENT. <br><br>All 3 times I ate here this week I had something different, had a different server and yet had basically the same experience as I have anywhere in the country at a Cheesecake Factory.... food was great, as expected, it&#39;s always consistent, drinks were great, they taste the same at all locations. The servers are nice, attentive, but if you go during busy dinner time expect the services to be busier than normal too!<br><br>If you read the low 1 star reviews people left... also do yourself a favor and go to &#34;their&#34; profile to see that they most likely have only reviewed 3 businesses and also gave a 1 star. Because those type of people like to complain over anything, especially waiting a few minutes for service. <br><br>Great menu items:<br>* Mac &amp; Cheese Balls<br>* Brussels Sprouts<br>* Nachos<br>* Alfredo Pasta<br>* Impossible Burger<br>And obviously the free bread!<br><br>They also have a great happy hour although I didn&#39;t get there in time for that but check the menu for items and prices.

This is a factory plain and simple.<br><br>The food is ok.  Though I can&#39;t say that you should order any item on the menu.  The food is not spectacular but have always been fresh and cooked right.<br><br>I&#39;ve always had decent service even at peak times but I usually use this place as a last option for some reason I am not particularly fond of the large format restaurants especially those with capacity of 300 or more.  But this one haven&#39;t yet disappointed me so I will probably visit again.

So I decided to come back to cheesecake again hoping the food is better. I ordered my usual it was ok but not nice and hot.  The hostess in the front a Spanish girl with glasses with the Dora explorer hair cut was rude as hell. Not sure what the problem is. Told me a 20 minute wait plus it was not busy lunch time on a Monday. Empty seats all over the place but telling me a 20 minute wait . Than I watch her seat ppl that came in after me. Not right or good. Need to be sent back to training.   Ugh.  Ugh

Went for Dinner<br><br>Food - 5/5. The bread selection they offer is lovely and the pumpernickel has good taste. Steak Diane had great crust with a warm pink center, just like how I asked for. Good seasoning on both the steak and mashed potatoes, with the mashed potato having nice chunks between the creaminess. The sauce was the main attraction of the whole dish as it added a nice savory and tart flavor to the entire plate.<br><br>Service - 4/5. We had a big party of people that was to arrive but many were late and about a quarter of them canceled last minute. The staff were still very accommodating and professional about the whole ordeal.<br><br>Value - 4/5. The pricing is pretty average as this is a chain restaurant. The food is good and for $20 you get a steak entree. Not bad at all!<br><br>Parking - Mall Lot/Garage (Free)

Got there at 11am and was not really crowded.  Ordered appetizers and drinks which came quick. Ordered entrees.  Took over half an hour before food came.  By that time we were no longer hungry. Server was apologetic and we know it was not her fault as the kitchen screwed up. Manager came and apologize but did not do anything. We took the food to go.  Manager and kitchen staff needs to get their act together. Would have given 1 star if not for server.

This Cheesecake Factory is huge, well decorated, and sexy! It&#39;s what I like to call the signature franchise look. HOWEVER let&#39;s talk about the food and service. We were meeting up with a friend who was already seated. We weren&#39;t greeted by a hostess nor were we walked to our table. Our server took forever to attend to us! From greeting us, to taking orders, and delivering the bill. I was looking forward to the mac &amp; cheese &#34;balls&#34; burger.  I&#39;ve had this burger in the past and love it!  When the food came out, it was a mac and cheese patty on a close to well done burger( I ordered it medium). The server was skimpy with the ketchup as well. We had to request more condiments. Let&#39;s  just say, I would not be back.

I just had a quick lunch at the Cheese Cake Factory Bar in the Short Hills Mall. <br>I&#39;ve been in the business so I know how difficult as well as how hard it can be behind the scenes. Kevin was such an amazing bartender! With a busy Sunday brunch/Dinner going on he made sure to keep asking me if I needed anything or he could be of any help with the extensive menu they offer.<br>I loved everything he recommended. I don&#39;t really ever leave reviews but I thought the food and the service deserved one!

I find this location super busy at the short hills mall. Lately it&#39;s been hit or miss. Service is good/ok but everyone looks rushed.  I notice small things like having a fork but no knife. Bread without butter served .Things that happen when staff is stressed/rushed and don&#39;t pay attention to detail. <br><br>Food has been mediocre at Cheesecake lately . Not awful but not like how I used to feel/be excited. Plus the calories are ridiculous with most meals. <br><br>Bang bang chicken and shrimp is one of my faves . I like the seared tuna salad, miso salmon. Lemon chicken. <br><br>Apps- I like the fire cracker salmon, avocado egg rolls, crab wontons

The Cheesecake Factory a national chain with restaurants in higher end malls or locations. Let me state that I have never been to a Cheesecake Factory restaurant ever. Two weeks ago, I was just blown away on my first visit. It was a WOW visit.<br><br>From the moment I walked in, I was just impressed with ambiance, service and food. What more can I say. It was just awesome.<br><br>I was at the Short Hills Mall waiting for the wife who works just across the street. I happen to enter another restaurant a few hundred feet away and just had a horrible experience. Everything that drives me crazy about service in a restaurant; they did.<br><br>Moving forward, as I walked in at the CF music was at right level. Perfect lighting. Everyone just busy doing their jobs, without looking like they where running around &#34;like a chicken without their head&#34;. Everything seem perfect and working right.<br><br>Found a seat at the bar and let me say it was busy. Bar area was packed with Happy Hour customers. Ordered a Mojito; delicious. Good. Damn good. It was as perfect a mojito as I ever had. That mixture of tartness and sweetness with the aromatic mint, made for a wonderful delight. Best part $5.95 for this delicious drink. Remember HH pricing.<br><br>Now I am a burger guy and when I see sliders I just order. It is the perfect food when enjoying adult beverages. The order consisted of 4 sliders that were moist and tasty. It was a real deal at $5.95 Happy Hour Special.<br><br>Service was just outstanding. Period. The young lady was personable, friendly and made a mean drink. Life is good. At 6:08 or so I asked if I can order apps. The Bartender said, let me check if they changed over from HH menu to regular menu and made it happen. No hassle. No drama. She just offer me the HH menu for food with no worries.<br><br>Overall, The Cheesecake Factory will be my Happy Hour place when in the area. With outstanding service, food and cocktails this customer is a very happy camper.

My family and I love the food at this place , however you would think a place named the Cheesecake Factory would operate a little faster since it is a factory , but they don&#39;t , they need to speed it up
Two stars just for the sake of our server, who provided us with excellent customer service. Other than that this is below average establishment with rude hostess and mediocre food.

I have never had a bad meal at Any Cheesecake<br>Factory the one in Short Hills included. Drinks are always on point and so is the food. There is always a wait at this location unless you get here when it opens. I usually go during peak days and hours. I have come on a Tuesday before and it was still crowded. So, if you don&#39;t mind a wait this location is just as good as any.

Really wished I checked the reviews before coming because this was as bad of an experience as the reviews say. What makes it worse was it was my birthday. <br><br>After ten minutes of being ignored, we finally had to flag someone down to ask who our waitress was.<br><br>Took 45 minutes for our food to come:<br><br>My chicken and biscuits had burnt biscuits and no mashed potatoes. I was told it would be 30 minutes to make more biscuits. My replacement order was wrong and tasted nasty. I sent it back and ended up not even eating dinner.<br><br>They didn&#39;t tell my aunt that there were out of soup until they delivered her food.<br><br>My other aunt&#39;s food was not warm. So was the replacement. She ended up not eating.<br><br>The waitress would never come over or refill our drinks.<br><br>My mom ordered food to go. They bring it up on a regular plate then later accuse us of not saying anything when they came over. At that point we all start laughing because it&#39;s been such a horrible experience.<br><br>I am still here so stay tuned. We still don&#39;t have our dessert order and they will probably screw that up too.

Typical Cheesecake Factory franchise. However they could use a better cleaning crew. The bathrooms were horrendous and it was only 7:30 at night. I feel for whoever had to use them later in the evening!<br>Our waiter was very attentive and friendly, making sure we were well taken care of. The service was quick and the food came out quickly. <br>The menu is a little over whelming as they have so many items to choose from but this could also be a bonus as it has something for the whole family. <br>Food was good as always and was prepared as expected, also another plus to franchises. You receive a large portion of food so there is always left overs! <br>Have to say all in all it was a decent experience but I have definitely been to cleaner cheesecake factories before. Need to up their game on cleanliness.
This place is a good right at the mall in summit shore hills.<br><br>Food is decent, and service is good.<br><br>This place is a go!

I regrettably was not able to eat at The Cheesecake Factory today but we did swing by to redeem two free slices of cheesecake. This review pertains only to the cheesecake we got to-go and literally nothing else (e.g., service, pricing, flavor), so I strongly believe that the five stars is wholly deserved. If you&#39;ve never tried one from the restaurant because of its exorbitant prices, TRY ONE! Yes, they&#39;re generally very expensive (and normally out of my budget), but they&#39;re sooo creamy. I don&#39;t even want to think about how many sticks of butter had to be sacrificed, but I am pleased. I got the fresh strawberry cheesecake (it&#39;s just regular cheesecake with strawberries) and it was AMAZING! If you like good things, you&#39;ll like this.<br><br>If you don&#39;t like cheesecake, then shame on you.

I love the Cheesecake Factory. I honestly do. I just wish the service was better. We waited 15 minutes for our server just for drinks.  Then we felt rushed as she immediately asked us over and over again for our entree order. We didn&#39;t even get our drinks yet. Just water. The chicken  madera looked so good on the yelp pictures, but came out dry and cool instead of hot.  This won&#39;t stop me from ever going back to another Cheesecake Factory. But i won&#39;t be nearly as excited as i used to be.

The food is great as usual. My first time having fried Mac and cheese and it was so good. They give 4 huge Mac and cheese balls that will have you stuffed before your meal even comes out. They also give bread and butter as you wait for your meal. Now I&#39;m not a big fan of bread but I truly enjoyed it. It was fresh, warm and absolutely delicious. It was so good I asked for more (which is unlike me). Our waiter was nice and super fast. Everything we asked for was given to us in the blink of an eye. I&#39;m really impressed by the service. I have one negative comment about the whole experience. I ordered grilled shrimp with my salad and the shrimp was cold. Maybe it&#39;s just me but I was expecting warm shrimp with my salad. Overall, the experience was great.

I absolutely adore the Cheesecake Factory.  When I come to my hometown for the holidays, we always Isis this particular location because of its&#39; convenient residence inside the mall. This location left us extremely disappointed though. Here&#39;s why...<br>1. First, there was a 40-minute wait. Ok, no biggie. It&#39;s the holidays. It&#39;s 8:00pm and the mall is closing in an hour. <br>2. As our buzzer went off and we get up to be seated at our table, in walks a man with a little chihuahua on a leash. All of our mouths dropped. One lady with a family of 5 asked the hostess if dogs were allowed in the restaurant. The server said, only service dogs. The lady exclaimed, &#34;that was not a service dog &amp; he was not blind&#34;. The hostess just shrugged her shoulders. The lady and her whole family canceled their reservation &amp; walked out exclaiming how unsanitary it was. I totally agreed. And had we not been starving and waited over 40 minutes, we would have left, too. Luckily, they sat us on the other side of the restaurant. <br>3. The service was horrible. Our table didn&#39;t have enough silverware, it took forever to get our bread and some of us got drinks while others didn&#39;t. I was with a party of four. When we requested more silverware, one of the other servers (not our waitress who couldn&#39;t be found) got it and apologized, stating it had been a crazy day. Again, cool. It&#39;s the holidays. We get it. <br>4. But, this last thing took the cake... we all began devouring our food, only to get halfway through &amp; my mom finds a long, curly black hair at the bottom of her plate. We were disgusted and informed the waitress. She took the plate, came back &amp; stayed she took it off the bill, but the manager argued with her that the hair didn&#39;t belong to any of the cooks because they were all men. Manager never came to our table to address the issue or apologize. <br><br>After the hair situation and lack of professionalism by the manager, we decided to skip dessert, pay our bill &amp; just leave. This has left a pretty bad taste in my mouth... literally. We will not return to this location EVER!

My husband, baby girl and I came for brunch before taking pictures with Santa at Short Hills mall. I&#39;ve actually never had brunch here before so didn&#39;t know what to expect but it wasn&#39;t bad.  We made it before the rush of folks. When we entered there were only 2 strollers at the door.  By the time we left, the stroller area was 4 strollers deep.  <br><br>Food: Their food menu has a good mix of healthy options and a number of breakfast tex-mex items.  My husband did their Eggs Benedict which was not as good as you would get at a jersey diner.  I had the breakfast tacos and those were actually pretty good.  Their coffee is a darker roast. <br><br>Decor: You&#39;ve been to one you have been to them all.  It&#39;s the same layout.  Lots of seats, the booths have plenty of privacy. <br><br>Price: Standard for nicer casual chain restaurants.  About $35 for two meals with coffee.<br><br>Service: Despite the size, service was very quick and friendly.  They seem to have efficiency down pretty well.<br><br>Parent Notes: The handicap stall of both bathrooms have a nice changing table at a decent height.  The booths BARELY fit an infant car seat so ask for a table seating instead if you need to keep your little one with you in a car seat and they can&#39;t sit in a high chair yet.<br><br>Notable Extras: Always consistent.

There always pretty good to me here. I normally come after work or sometimes during the day after shopping . The staff is pretty cool...the food is always good here. Definitely cant complain. <br><br>Ps-it&#39;s normally more crowded during the day so if you come at night it&#39;s a little more laid back.

2.5 stars and that&#39;s IT! We waited less than 5 minutes for our table which was great. But when we sat down, we noticed that the table was dirty and there was food all over the floor. A lady came over to clean it and insisted that it wasn&#39;t dirty! Um, we&#39;re not blind. Our waiter blamed it on a kid that was there before us which was no excuse. After we placed our order, it took 42 minutes for our food to come out &amp;  it came our barely warm. I hate to send food back but my broccoli was ice cold! The brunch combo was extremely boring- dry pancakes, overcooked bacon and my over easy eggs were over hard!! The chicken fingers were pretty good- too bad it was paired with old celery. Our waiter was clearly over his job and it showed. So, believe the reviews that you read on here! This is a beautiful restaurant with ugly service and hit or miss food!

Always a solid happy hour with great bartenders but the food just isn&#39;t that good. It&#39;s often poorly made (has to send my quesadillas back for not being hot or melted plus there wasn&#39;t much chicken) and the bathrooms are always disgusting and not kept clean. I overheard a bartender saying they hoped corporate would come soon to make some changes and I hope the same for their sake.

One of the worst dining experiences. Service was ridiculously slow and waitress was extremely inattentive. Waited 20 minutes before waitress acknowledged us and then about 15 minutes to receive water. Appetizers and entrees took about an hour to arrive. Proceeded to take out counter after we finished to order some desserts to go and 4 employees literally standing around doing nothing while not acknowledging any of us customers waiting to order. Obviously the management here doesn&#39;t care enough since most reviews say similar things yet nothing changes. Definitely won&#39;t be returning

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. Walked in with a party of 4. We waited 25 minutes after sitting down to receive a drink order... not drinks... drink order. We asked for a basket of only wheat/brown bread and placed our appetizer and dinner orders. Our waitress then comes back 10 min later to tell us that they are out of the wheat/brown bread after we had saw her walking with an entire basket of brown bread to a table? Hmmm not sure if that&#39;s correct. She said she would go double check and then sent a manager to our table. Who did not acknowledge the issue of our waitress carrying out a basket full of only wheat bread and then telling us there was none left. The manager then comes to tell us that they have been out of brown bread for the past hour, which then further confused and complicated things. <br>Our appetizers came out before our drinks as well. And we were never offered a refill in the 55 minutes it took for our food to come out. We contacted another waiter about this who was nearby and he thankfully brought our drinks out to us. Following this, our food came out and someone at our tables food was cold. He had ordered the chicken Parm &#34;Pizza Style&#34; and the chicken came out soggy and cold and the pasta was dry. <br>Overall, probably one of the worst dining experiences as our waitress came to our table twice in an hour + time period, the managers failed to acknowledge the main issues going on (horrible service and lack of clarity), and cold food.<br><br>Fast forward 1 month later, my boyfriend got a gift card to the Cheesecake Factory from a friend so we decided to go by ourselves and give it another try. I do not live in this area, let alone this state, and both times the wheat/brown bread was either gone or not ready. Service was better this time and other than the bread things had been going pretty well. I ordered the Parmesan crusted chicken with broccoli and my boyfriend ordered pasta carbonara. Our food came out in a timely fashion... but my mashed potatoes were lukewarm and crusted on the top while my broccoli was cold. I sent it back to be warmed up and by the time it came back my boyfriend had already finished his dish. Overall I&#39;ve been to this place twice in a 1 month period and have been disappointed both times with either the service or food.<br><br>Needless to say, I haven&#39;t had this problem with any other Cheesecake Factory restaurants I&#39;ve been too, and I believe this one has some work to do.

Good food, ok service.  Always a wait.  The server wasn&#39;t terribly good this time, refusing to accommodate our request to leave the Mayo off the sandwich.  He said it&#39;s a new menu item and they can&#39;t leave the Mayo off.  On what planet, does this make sense. <br><br>You know, as I type this review, I get even more annoyed, so I&#39;m taking another star off.

I should have read the reviews first. I was not happy with my food. I had the fish and chips. The fish taste like it was cooked earlier and microwaved to order. Some parts were soft and some were hard. My tarter sauce tasted like blue cheese dressing. I gave it two stars because of the Cheesecake.  That was good.

Thinking of ordering take out? Think again. This cheesecake factory location has made me wait on the phone EVERY TIME (exactly 3) I&#39;ve called to order for at least 45 mins.<br><br>I get the restaurant is busy, and the server is seating incoming customers and managing the take out phone simultaneously, but 45 minutes is just not right. 30 minutes into listening to reception music from the underside of 2006, I call to politely remind the front desk that I am waiting to order. I am always rudely transferred to back to hold, without comment or apology. Then I wait out of principle. I&#39;ve started to think this location likes to punish people who try to order take out. Operant conditioning to deter take out orders. <br><br>I&#39;ve eaten at this location and the food is as good as at any other location. Regardless, treating all patrons with respect and efficiency is entirely lacking. If I can&#39;t order food after 45 minutes, it&#39;s not a restaurant, its a bad waiting room radio station.<br><br>Cheese, yah gotta do better

It&#39;s always a pleasure to come here! I love the atmosphere and how amazing the food is ! Starting from the bread to dessert, everything was deliciousssss and filling. Especially the oreo cheesecake...omgoodness, I can still taste it! I definitely recommend people to come here for a nice, yummy meal if they&#39;re in the mall! <br><br>The only thing is, because they are so good, they are usually busy so they did not come around to refill our waters which was annoying because I was parched.
The food was good, the server was nice but always check your utensils. We found some dirt on this spoon and fork.
Solid SkinnyLicious meal once again.  I always order off the Skinny menu and always enjoy the portion and taste of the food.  The service is usually pretty good.

The restaurant was not packed at all and still took over an hour for the food to come out. Saw other tables who ordered after us get there food before. Our order was extremely basic. Soda came out flat, fries were cold and burnt. Finally part of the food came out but took another 15 minutes for the rest. we told the manager who did nothing about it. Extremely disappointing as we eat here a lot but now rethinking it.

Very unhappy with my visit today! Brought two guests out of the country on vacation to have dinner. We were in four, first came one order the other 3 others 20min later. Hardly the server came to check on the table. Everything we order after took some time to come, more than usual. The ribeye steak needs a thinker cut and better size.  Unfortunately this visit today wasn&#39;t very nice. And at this time 9:30pm the restaurant was pretty empty. Needs improvement. Makes me consider bringing new guests here and/or coming to this location again.

So the Cheesecake Factory at Short Hills always seems to disappoint me BUT I continue to visit because the food is not what I complain about....IT&#39;S THE SERVICE!!!! <br><br>Place is clean, the people are nice, but OMG it was slow.  <br><br>Met with my girls and you need to be on top of your server.  We ordered soup and 15-20min went by and we realized we didn&#39;t even order our entrees.  The waiter explained 7 tables just got pushed on him but it&#39;s not an excuse......it&#39;s a Monday night!<br><br>So ended up having corn chowder which was delicious then the following:<br><br>Luau Salad - The dressing was yummy and the crunchiness was perfectly blended with the rest of the ingredients.  We shared this amongst 4 gals and it was more than enough.<br><br>Louisiana Chicken Pasta - don&#39;t like spicy...don&#39;t order this....it has a nice kick to it and I love bowtie pasta.  Chicken is pan fried....really yummy.<br><br>Wish we had time for dessert....but like I said service was slow.<br><br>Yah I would come back....just so convenient after shopping.  Hope the service is better the next time around AGAIN.

The waiter service was horrible! It was so bad that we had to ask other waiters for service.<br>Our waiter was more attentive to other patrons...<br><br>We were seated very quickly, which is the only good thing about this experience.

One time I came here and they brought out everyone&#39;s food almost 20 minutes apart. So we told them to wrap it up and we left. Kinda irritating when you plan on sitting down to enjoy your food. Really good food though so that is cool.

I haven&#39;t been here since I was 14 and it was cool to come for a birthday dinner...and judging by my most recent experience, that&#39;s probably a good thing. I knew it had been a long time when I discovered that they had a cocktail menu. Last time I came here, I didn&#39;t even know what a cocktail was.<br><br>I game in for lunch with some of my girlfriends after an exhausting day of bridesmaid dress shopping. I had a bunch of mixed emotions during our lunch, and because of that I&#39;ll settle on an even 3. Here&#39;s why: <br><br>5 Stars- The menu selection. If you&#39;ve ever been to a cheesecake factory before, you&#39;ll know that their menu is a small novel. There is a ton to choose from, and plenty of decadent sounding lunch specials. Oh also, their hot sourdough bread and butter is the stuff that dreams are made of. <br><br>4 Stars- The Mojito. It had fresh muddled mint and blueberry. It was divine. <br><br>3 Stars- The overall dining experience. Read on and you&#39;ll see why...<br><br>2 Stars- The service was waaaack. No one asked how we were doing and it took like 30 minutes to bring us our check...after we asked 10 times. <br><br>1 Star- The food. I should have stuck to what I knew, but I honestly didn&#39;t think that fried chicken sliders could be messed up. Instead of 2 or 3 neatly presented sliders, it was a platter of haphazardly assembled greasy chicken patties and mushy buns with a mess of lettuce and tomato on the side. I felt like I was ten and eating a meal at summer camp. Super nasty. <br><br>It&#39;s not the worst mall chain restaurant to snag a quick meal at...next time I&#39;ll just need to stick to what I know.

The service is very slow. Our server said that the kitchen messed up cooking the orange chicken so they had to re-cook we waited for my daughter&#39;s meal for a looooooong time. Mind you I don&#39;t know why the chef would mess up cooking their well known specialty dish.  The manager was great though in addressing the complaint 1star for that but they need to train their staff better.

I&#39;ve eaten there in the past but this time I felt the need to voice my disgust at my experience. I went to dinner with my daughter last Friday. I ordered the shrimp linguine and my daughter ordered a burger. The waiter asked how we wanted the burger cooked and my 11-year old daughter was uncertain so I spoke up for her and told them the meat should be well done. Well we were eating and chatting when my daughter points to her burger- turns out she was halfway done eating it when she noticed it had quite a bit of blood on the inside. At this point I had already paid but was completely disgusted. I asked to speak to a manager to voice my concerns. The manager simply made excuse after excuse after excuse. I can&#39;t even remember if there was an apology in the midst of his excuses. I doubt it. <br>Anyway I&#39;m disgusted not only about the undercooked Food my child was eating but also about the way the manager handled the situation. He was rude and unprofessional. For that reason in itself I won&#39;t be back.

We were looking forward to going to the restaurant tonight and the experience was really bad. Over an hour wait until we got a seat for our family of 5. The place was crowded and very noisy the whole evening. We waited for the menus, waited to get our order in, waited about an hour to get the food (which came at different times), then waited for someone to clean our dishes, waited for someone to clean the table, waited for the dessert menu and again waited to pay. The entire experience was painful and very frustrating. All together it took over three hours. The last time we came wasn&#39;t nice, so we have it another chance. We won&#39;t be coming there anymore.

Forgot to check in, but had to come back to post about it.  I had Chicken Bellagio: Breaded chicken ( scallopini style ), prosciutto, arugula, basil pasta over cream sauce. It was heavenly! I totally food-gasmed!

My worst experience here. I&#39;ve been coming here for years.. maybe management has changed but the service and food was not good. I&#39;m not so picky that I need everything perfect but the difference in service was so obvious from previous experiences.<br>It will be a long while before I return to this location.

I went for a Sunday brunch and arrived around 12:30- no wait time! The brunch options are pretty good1 I ordered the fried chicken and waffles Benedict. The breakfast potatoes had virtually no flavor and tasted like they were drenched in oil. The chicken was nice and crispy, but the waffle was soggy. I would&#39;ve preferred they pour the hollandaise sauce directly on the poached eggs and not on the side. However, good portion! Overall OK meal- nothing to brag about but there are plenty of other options here for a brunch.

We went for happy hour. The waitress we had never was around and never offered us a refill on our drinks so we skipped desert service was bad. Our waitress disappeared for 20 minutes.  I was already ready to leave. I asked for the check and to go bag that took her 10 minutes. Walked away not feeling happy about this place. Carry your patience with you.

I&#39;m giving the Cheesecake Factory in Short Hills, NJ 3 stars only because I love their food. As far as calling in an order for pickup, that&#39;s another story. I was put on hold 4 times for an average of 10 minutes each time. So I called the Cheesecake Factory in Wayne, NJ.... Same thing. Completely unacceptable. Why aren&#39;t the phone operators being monitored???
Never going back. Dirty forks and knives. Fruit flies all around us. Smaller portions than any other Cheesecake Factory I have been in. Smaller cocktails. The one in Menlo Park is so much better.

Ordered Doordash for 2 people tonight, over $80 total for the convenience factor of a lazy Sunday.  Cheesecake Factory didn&#39;t even include bread in the order and the food arrived barely warm.  Won&#39;t ever order to go or delivery again from them based on principle alone that you shouldn&#39;t be treated any differently if you get it to go.

Mom got a chicken dish and we all shared it as she said it tasted funny. We were out to prove her wrong.  We all spent our night hugging the toilet. Food poisoning big time. So be careful eating here.

My weekly brunch date at Cheesecake Factory never fails me. I decided this week to have the Chicken and Waffles Benedict. It was a bit more busy than most weekends but waiting for my food was SO WORTH THE WAIT! It was so good! I can tell that their was love put into that dish!!! Also, my bartender, I know he wears glasses and he has been working there for years, (I worked at the mall for so many years) went to see were my dish was and I wasn&#39;t even in a hurry and he had a full bar. I love the fact that especially behind the bar there are still the same familiar faces that I have known for years and they always have a smile or they remember what you are going to have. I love the consistency with the staff. It really goes a long way with the customer service experience and they should be recognized for it. Thank you as always guys!

Came here for dessert and coffee after dinner. Our server was Anthony, he was really nice but not attentive at all. For me when I go out to eat, I don&#39;t necessarily need for you to get things individually one by one. Everything didn&#39;t come out exactly at the same time. My party ordered three cheesecakes, two coffees, and a latte. Everything came back one after another. Same thing when it came to the check. Dropping off the check, waited ten minutes, picked up the check, we told him we wanted to get containers to go, dropped off the check to the table, waited longer to get the containers. I&#39;ve never had a problem with the actual food at any Cheesecake Factory but it is inevitable that every night you are going to be busy and packed. We went on a Wednesday night and for just dessert turned into almost over an hour just waiting for service alone. I hate to take down about service if only I was aware if not the server but the management not having enough people working.

The service is fast and precise. I had a four cheese pasta with chicken. Which exceeded my expectations. My friend had salmon with mashed potatoes and broccoli. Which was also pretty good. Overall the food was great, service up to par. Easy access for a car, parking lot right outside. On the negative side the floor was VERY slippery for some reason. I had to grab on to whatever i could while walking to and from my table

The Cheesecake Factory? More like The Snoozecake Factory. Simply AWFUL. 15 minutes for menus. 25 minutes for drinks 55 minutes for entrees that come BEFORE the appetizers. This place is not an example of mismanagement, but LACK OF TOTAL MANAGEMENT. The wait was the good part though. The appetizers came out AFTER the entrees all wrong, but in an odd chain of occurrences, the entrees were wrong too, and also needed to be sent back, talk about FOOD WASTE. Basicly every single item we ordered besides white wine was incorrect or improperly made. Restaurant ran out of 4 menu items (extremely odd for a chain restaurant). Failed to make the famous Evelyn pasta THREE TIMES (literally made it 3 times over and NOT ONE VERSION was the &#34;Evelyn&#34; pasta we eat at 6 other cheesecake locations across the country). Every version came out of the kitchen with the chef&#39;s very own twist (also VERY ODD for a FRANCHISE) rather than the menu description and with a heavy, heavy hand of salt and oregano (EWw). Chicken Madeira tasted like it was doused with kerosene and also needed to be remade. The famous make your own Thai chicken lettuce wraps came already made for us as tacos rolled in hot, soft, wilted lettuce (this is not the way Cheesecake factory serves this dish and also a HEALTH HAZARD). After complaining to the waiter several times and talking to the manager several times, the waiter continues to come over and ask us time after time and says, &#34;So..UM...what&#39;s wrong?&#34; and &#34;So...what&#39;s going on guys?&#34; IT WAS LIKE THE TWILIGHT ZONE. When we discussed all these issues with the manager never once an apology, he just says to us: &#34;Ohhhhhhh.............thank you.&#34; - and walks away - WHAT?!?! crazy!!!!! So, can we give this place zero stars? Finally the manager&#39;s manager who seemed *slightly* more aware of the issues came over to say hello, although she was very sweet, needs a VERY big lesson on customer service and hospitality, I mean, she acted like what she did by removing 1 appetizer from our bill, maybe a damn slice of cheesecake after all of these issues would have been nice????? The cherry on top of our imaginary cheesecake was when we asked one of your employees to kindly watch us (2 females) walk out to the car as it was very late at night and dark out, he comes outside with us, waves, enthusiastically, &#34;Good night ladies!!!!!&#34; and goes RIGHT BACK INSIDE !!! After we explained to please watch us get into our car safely !!!!! I guess you guys forgot the murder that occurred in Short Hills parking lot in broad daylight just a few holiday seasons ago. HOW  <br>MORONIC????? If you want to take a trip to Psycholand , this is it ! AWFUL AWFUL EXPERIENCE AND VERY DISAPPOINTED IN THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY AS A FRANCHISE TO ALLOW THIS LOCATION TO EXIST. ZERO COMMON SENSE. ZEOR HOSPITALITY.

The bartenders here are the absolute best and provide top notch service no matter how busy they are!  Seriously, the reason I keep coming back. The food is good, avocado egg rolls, chicken taquitos, Greek salad, and the spinach dip are some favorites. And the cheesecake, obvi.

After such an incredible meal at Cheesecake Factory yesterday, I knew first thing I wanted to do Monday morning was leave them a five star review. I am so surprised to see so many negative and one star reviews for this location. Especially so many within the last month! <br><br>My fiancé and I were shopping at Short Hills Mall when we decided to stop in for a late lunch/early dinner. As with every other Cheesecake Factory, this place was packed. The hostess told us it would be about a half hour wait. We put our names down, grabbed a buzzer, and plopped down in the waiting area. 15 minutes later, I felt a buzz, buzz, buzz in my back pocket, we weaved our way through the herd of people waiting for a table and were ushered right to a nice intimate table for two.<br> <br>Both feeling healthy we decided to order off the SkinnyLicious menu and boy was it delicious. I got the Lunch Miso Salmon substituting the white rice for spinach. My fiancé got the grilled steak medallions. Both entrees were outstanding. My salmon was packed with so much flavor. It tasted just as good as if I got it from Nobu. We also decided to split the Korean Fried Cauliflower (which was probably one of the best appetizers I had a very long time) and the Edemame.<br><br>We were so full and satisfied that we couldn&#39;t even order a cheesecake. You can always count on a great meal from this place. Even our waitress was really great. She checked on us often enough, and always made sure our waters were full. We don&#39;t eat at Cheesecake factory often, but when we do come back I already know what I want to order.

Follow up to my initial review of the cheesecake factory visit.  I respond to the request of the representative who wrote on my page to basically be told that they could not find a record of my visit.  <br><br>If the company honeslty looked into the complaint there is no way they would not be able to find a record of me being at this resturant on September 20th. When you arrive they always ask for your name so that they can put your name down in the computer or on the paper so that you could be seated in the order that you arrived and availability. Secondly, I&#39;m sure an establishment as large as there&#39;s has cameras, third but not the least my party paid with several credit cards that night so I am site that the company would have records of that. <br><br>If The Cheesecake factory  didn&#39;t want to take this issues seriously they should not have responded to review of one of their establishment.

Disgusting tables, silverware, and glasses.  They should be ashamed of themselves and the leadership should be fired. See my photos as you will notice how dirty this place is.  Health inspectors should and will be notified.
The service is terrible. We waited for 30min for the bread and water. And the food is terrible too!!  So different from other Cheesecake Factory locations. Don&#39;t come here

This Cheesecake Factory was pretty packed on a Saturday night. Got here around 7:00 and had to wait an HOUR for a table. I guess it&#39;s expected but still. <br><br>Just your typical Cheesecake Factory. We love the Chicken Bellagio ~ I think it&#39;s the best thing on the menu. Had the chicken Picatta this weekend, nothing too special. <br><br>Cheesecake it good though. Loved the Godiva Cheesecake. The hazelnut Cheesecake had a little too much cake base it in but was pretty tasty

This will be my last time going to this Cheesecake Factory. Every visit, the service has deteriorated. The server passed our table numerous times, and didn&#39;t offer assistance. To make matters worse, a handicapped patron in a wheelchair was directed to a table and the chair was not removed for them. I offered to move it for the gentleman. <br>Our orders were wrong and no one seemed apologetic, except for the manager.<br>I can find somewhere else to get my cheesecake.
One of my favorite restaurant, I like the free bread very much, Cobb salad is fresh and big plate

From the moment I walked in I knew I should had left. First they said there was no wait for 3. 15 minutes later they call us and as we are walking to the table they realized that the table was dirty. Another 15 minutes later we were sat. Under the table it was still dirty and no one seemed to care. For starters we order fried calamaries and sweet tamales. The calamaries were fill with French fries and super wet and gummy like they were not cooked through.  The sauce seemed to have been sitting out and started turning color. My son who loves calamaries and at 6 can eat the whole order said they were disgusting. The tameles which are the reason I went there were ok, a little too soft compare to other tamales I had at other locations. Then for the entree we had the kid cheese pizza, shrimp scampi and bbq chicken salad. The salad was ok nothing really had flavor, then the shrimp scampi presentation was awesome and made you feel it was going to be delicious but the pasta was over cooked and tasteless. The shrimp were also gummy and flavorless. The cheese pizza was better than my entree . For desert we had the lemonchello which was amazing. Wished I just picked up the cheese cake and saved my 100 dollars. Will not visit this location again. Its sad when the free bread was better than anything you ordered.

I&#39;m from California and this store would never cut it there. <br>Service: meh. 3 times I&#39;ve come here in as many days (bus. trip) bad service. At 4:10 pm with about 10 tables occupied it 5 mins to get my Sprite. It&#39;s :15 now and still no bread. <br>Cleanliness: Dirty/grimy ... Everywhere. Bathroom filthy. <br>No one really makes eye contact unless absolutely necessary. <br>Hold on, I have to ASK for my bread....server disappeared 5 mins ago. <br>The only redeeming value is their good cheesecake. <br>Music: VERY ethnic. Not dining music.<br>I may start avoiding CF&#39;s all together with them trending this way.<br>Posted 12/17. <br>Last visit: 6/17<br>Delay in review due to technical glitch on Yelp.

Aside of the chaos in the ever-busy Short Hills Mall location, we enjoy coming to cheesecake with the family. I really don&#39;t understand the need to have so much on the menu and find it quite overwhelming as well. I also don&#39;t understand why it took me so long to see that I was ordering way too many appetizers that my entree always ended up getting packed up lol<br><br>While you&#39;re not going to find culinary genius here, it is pretty much a safe bet to get some decent food. The quality of some dishes are hit or miss, and sometimes depend on the day I guess since we can order the same dish and quality varies. Also, when you stretch the ability to control the food across so many menu items that is the result. For the kids, the Mac and cheese is a solid hit and the fries are great. Avocado rolls are delicious (subject to variation in taste) and wings are solid. We went for the crab and artichoke dip which was not edible and had no flavor. Chicken sliders were good on prior visits but this time the chicken was cut too small and was drowned by the bun.<br><br>Moral here is that options are not always great when they can cause your to shut down and default to what you know. Takes away from being able to explore other dishes since you don&#39;t want to risk it.

Hate to dis this place but the manager here does not know what he is doing. Does not belong in the hospitality business. I&#39;m sure that the staffs inability to get their shit together has everything to do with his lack of leadership skills.<br>My daughter suggested I clarify what manager I am referring to the big guy with the red shirt. Any decent manager would have introduced himself to me and made sure my experience was on a par  after my first complaint.

The food is always excellent. The problem lies in the service. On a weekday its usually okay, but on a weekend its usually quite poor. Expect to wait at least 45 minutes and have people at other  tables an inch apart from you. Worst of all is the noise. This place is the loudest restaurant I&#39;ve ever been in.

We&#39;ve been to this place many times. I enjoy TCF and its many menu options. Our family of four went there on a Saturday night. It was the standard 30-min wait but we didn&#39;t mind. We went strolling through the mall during the wait. So this is the sequence of events tonight:<br><br>7:15 - we are seated and our waiter immediately takes our drink order<br>7:30 - our drinks arrive in staggered fashion with the beer arriving last; we place our food order<br>8:00 - couple in table next to us leave<br>8:05 - new couple arrives at the empty table<br>8:20 - our waiter apologizes for our long wait and says he&#39;ll find out what&#39;s happening in the kitchen <br>8:25 - our neighboring couple&#39;s food arrives; I go ask the front desk (since our waiter is MIA) why we&#39;ve been waiting so long for our food; manager says he&#39;ll find out<br>8:30 - our food arrives but we&#39;re fuming mainly because someone f&#39;ed up and everyone was pointing fingers (manager said kitchen messed up; waiter said he had no idea; food servers said they&#39;re just doing as told).<br><br>So we waited a full hour for our food (nothing complicated - Caesar salad, two steaks, and one chicken) and we told them to take it back. I said I would pay for drinks, but the manager was nice in saying that our drinks are covered. But, if anything could have salvaged the evening, it would have been a word from the manager or waiter saying that he screwed up (instead of blaming it on the kitchen) and asking us to enjoy our food with drinks on us (or some other discount for the long wait). <br><br>In any case, bring food to customers in the order they arrived and everyone should be happy. This place is a madhouse on Friday and Saturday evenings. That is just my one bad experience. I&#39;m fairly sure by their popularity that others have good experiences. So take this for what it&#39;s worth - just one review among many.

I love the Cheesecake Factory but the service here sucks. This location is close to my house but it&#39;s definitively worth it to travel the extra mile to Paramus. I gave this location too many chances but today&#39;s definitely my last. Our food took over an hour to come out and we had a child with us. We arrived at 7 and didn&#39;t leave until 8:40. We got our food at 8:30 and left at 8:40. No apologies just a ton of excuses. No visit from a manager not even a single update on where our food was in the process. The service here is horrible. Farewell Shorthills Cheesecake Factory.

The Menlo Park mall location is much better.  This one always low balls the wait time by at least 50 %. <br>Just waited 45 mins after being told 20.  When we finally get seated guess what..I see at least half a dozen empty tables.  Wtf <br>This is the only CF that I have been to that doesn&#39;t seem to run like clockwork.<br>On a positive note they make up for a service slip up. Someone in our party was missing part of their order and it didn&#39;t come out until the meal was almost done. Without us even asking the mgr came out and apologized and offered us a comp desert. Much appreciated.

Service is sometimes slow but the food is fabulous! Friendly staff. Great place for going out to dinner both with families and alone on a romantic date night. My personal favorite is the dumplings! Great atmosphere and a chill place to hang.
The service is hit or miss. I ordered takeout and the syrup was not syrup...it wasn&#39;t even sticky. It looked like the poured oil into the container mixed with something else.

The portions are so big here I am always full by the appetizer. Love their vegetarian lettuce wraps. My fav thing on the menu is the avocado egg rolls with cashew cilantro dipping sauce. The falafel salad was good just needed more seasoning or a lemon dressing.  The cobb salad looked great and had a chipotle dressing that was very creamy. This is the place to indulge portions are humungous!

The pasta, Evenly&#39;s favorite, is delicious. However, it took the kitchen too long to prepare the burger. According to what they told us, someone dropped the burger to the floor so they had to make another one. We would like the burger to be medium and come with sweet potato fries. What we got after 40+ minutes were a well-done patty with potato fries. Moreover, the waitress forgot to serve us the bread the entire time. We prefer only buying cakes from this place in future, which might be the only safe choice that won&#39;t disappoint us.

This is a staple for all NJ eaters. If you want to get great value and also have one of the biggest menus to choose from, Cheesecake Factory is for you! Although the name can throw you off, their food is more than just dessert. Pasta and salad dishes are quite good as well as some asian fusion dishes. They really can do it all. It&#39;s not the most sophisticated food in the world but the flavor and portions are on point!<br><br>We always order the spicy ahi tuna tempura app and are never disappointed. Kobe beef sliders were good as well. My father in law always gets the Chicken Fettucini, quite tasty. The ladies love the Cobb salad, tons of bacon and chicken! Come here to gorge but if it&#39;s busy be prepared to wait....

After the NY Winter Wine Festival at the Hilton we went across the road to the cheesecake factory for some much needed chow. I normally go to the Bridgewater or Menlo Park locations. Thinking that all Cheesecake factories are created equal I ordered my usual. My sister and I shared a Ceasar Salad( that was good) and the Dynamite Shrimp (overcooked and greasy). <br><br>For entrees I had my usual shrimp and salmon combo with mash potatoes and asparagus and my sister had a burger and fries. My Combo came out and the shrimp were so brown I didn&#39;t recognize the dish. The salmon was not very warm but I ate it while I asked for new shrimp .<br> I was a little surprised when the manager came over he didn&#39;t offer to take the entire plate and fix order instead he just got me new shrimp . I actually enjoy the combo when I eat a little shrimp and salmon in same bite so this killed it for me . <br>My sisters burger came out with no fries because they were making them still. FRIES really they are the shortest thing to cook.???<br><br> Anyway I did get an replacement shrimp it was less dark in appearance but a little gummy . I told the manager when leaving it still WASN&#39;T RIGHT,  He told me he watched them while making it and they did it right. So I guess I was wrong lol. <br><br>The Bartenders really saved the experience as they made us amazing Stoli O cosmos and were very pleasant.  I would NOT order my favorite dish from this location EVER ! At best I would probably  have drinks at happy hour price.

My first time at any Cheesecake Factory location and overall, a bit of a discordant experience. The food options and quality were a shade above your normal full-service chains, the prices right in line with other competitive offerings, and the decor/lighting very relaxed and inviting. My complaint however, resides solely in the customer service experience, which judging from previous reviews, is an all too common occurrence. After we were seated, our party was forced to wait an obscenely long time to place our orders and the service after our food arrived was similarly lackadaisical. <br><br>I understand that we dined during peak hours, and while not blaming the waitress who served our table, the blame must be accepted by the managers on location. The experience has not put me off entirely, but changes should be made to necessitate future visits.

I went to this location the Saturday after valentine&#39;s and it was horrific to say the least. I won&#39;t be back. After being seated it took out server who I believe was named shameka ten or so minutes to ever show up to our table. Then I actually had to go ask the staff if we had a waiter. When we sat down the table wasn&#39;t cleaned off and the previous couples check and money was still on the table. The server was rude and neglent and didn&#39;t listen to the order carefully. Her attitude was off and very phony. She wanted to serve the ppl around us but not ya for some reason. I wish I had asked to change the server now I think of it and did report it to the management via a phone call because I was so bothered. What a waste of money and a valentine&#39;s dinner. I have never felt so bad eating at a restaurant and I will never go na

So let me preface this by saying don&#39;t go to a Cheesecake Restaurant and try to order steak. I made the mistake so you don&#39;t have to. Now if you read this and decide to order a steak after I told you not to, that&#39;s on you. <br><br>My girlfriends and I arrived on Friday, a little after 6:00 and were told there was a 10-15 minute wait. We didn&#39;t have any issue with that because we hadn&#39;t seen each other for a bit and we 3 are gifted with the gift of gab! We didn&#39;t wait 10 minutes which was great. <br><br>On to my dinner, which left me underwhelmed. So I ordered the Hibachi Steak because I let my anemia choose the entreé. It was supposed to come with Wasabi Potatoes and Tempura Asparagus, but I substituted Tempura Asparagua for regular asparagus.<br><br>Our waiter, Joey was very patient with us, as we had one wholly indecisive member in our party. He had to visit 3 times before the entire table was ready, but I ordered an Herbal tea to pass the time. <br><br>So I was really excited to try Wasabi Potatoes but unfortunately I was served a GIANT pile of regular unsalted red-skinned potatoes. There wasn&#39;t a whiff of Wasabi in the mashed potatoes (which is pretty hard to miss), nor did I see wasabi on the side, so that left me disappointed. Also, I don&#39;t know about anyone else but when I order steak (and pay damn near $22 for it) potatoes should be a side! I go to a restaurant for food I can&#39;t make myself, and I certainly don&#39;t get steak and potatoes to eat the potatoes! <br><br>The meal was mostly blah potatoes, about 2 pieces of cut up asparagus, and maybe 6 or 7 slivers of damn near done steak (which I requested cooked medium) Also, I&#39;m an adult, and I want to cut up my own damn piece of meat. Just saying.<br><br>Anyhow I ate half of my giant plate of potatoes and saved space for the Chocolate Tuxedo Cheesecake which was plated so nicely, that I almost forgot my underwhelming steak dinner. <br><br>Our waiter was busy and so I didn&#39;t bother to address the steak situation but there seemed to be individuals going around watching people eat but they didn&#39;t ask us how our dinner was going, so I left well enough alone. <br><br>Next time I&#39;ll just skip dinner and go straight to the cheesecake. They&#39;ve got those down, dinner service not so much.

After an hour wait (Saturday night at 7:45 so I get it) we sit down at a table that still has food residue from the previous patrons.  Every single utensil was dirty and crusted with food despite the table having the appearance of it being just set.  I looked for a server but no one would pay attention to us so I decided to gather up the silver and dirty folded napkins and remove them from the table myself while I cleaned the table using my sons baby wipes.  I was finally approached by a waitress who was pleasant.  I showed her the dirty silver and she removed it immediately.  We ordered food and it arrived in a fairly timely manner.  But it is a bit difficult to eat without any silverware.  Yes, she had forgotten to replace our cutlery.  A few moments later she returned in a very casual manner and said &#34;here you go&#34;.  Food wasn&#39;t bad...  nothing to write home about but it was what we expected.  Half of our plates were cleared and we asked to see a dessert menu.  10 minutes went by and no menus.  We start to look for the waitress and see her talking with her coworkers.  She notices us looking at her and finally graces is with some menus.  She takes our order and the wait begins.  5 minutes...  10 minutes...  15 minutes go by and still no food.  We look but can&#39;t seem to find our server anywhere.  She finally arrives to tell us that there is a delay with the cakes and it&#39;s going to be a few more minutes. My wife gets up and notices an entire counter by the cakes overflowing with plated food and the cooks standing there talking.  I assume the waitress forgot to order our food.  We ask for it to go as it&#39;s now late but also ask for the check while we are waiting so we can hurry things along.  Again, a very &#34;oh well&#34; attitude and demeanor from our waitress.  8 minutes later (yes I timed it) she finally brings out to go desserts with the check.  Horrible service...  very slow and very dirty.  Won&#39;t be back...  unless I have 3 hours to kill and want to eat off of a dirty table.

I come here often and I like it everytime.<br><br>FOOD &amp; DRINKS<br><br>I love their bread first and foremost. Its pumpernickel and delicious. I can get full just off of the bread but my favorite dish is the four cheese pasta I get this every time and never get tired of it. Every dish is pretty good from here so you cannot really go wrong and they guaranteed have something you&#39;re in the mood for because their menu is very long. <br><br>My favorite drinks are the strawberry-banana daiquiri and the georgia peach. They are so good! The georgia peach is my go to because it is s hard to find from other places. <br><br>SERVICE<br><br>It varies on the waiter, but service is relatively good here. They can get pretty crowded so sometimes the wait is long as hell and there are too many tables to pay attention to- they&#39;re pretty good though. <br><br>I like to come here, definitely worth it! They aren&#39;t too expensive either and that is always a plus.
Just came here for Happy Hour.. Ordered Tex Mex Eggrolls, Factory Nachos &amp; Long Island Iced Teas ALL $5.95... I forgot to take pics but food was delicious..

I wasn&#39;t particularly blown away.   Sat at the bar, had the calamari and the sweet fries.  It was good and I would come back but my socks weren&#39;t blown off as I  had expected.  Service at bar was ok could have been more attentive.... Asked for water... I never got my water,  etc.<br>The pizza margharita was good.  The carrot cake was HUGE!!  (&#34;That&#39;s what she said.&#34;)<br><br>I&#39;ll go back and try to add a star to this review....<br><br>Overall it was just ok

I&#39;m not sure what the deal with this place is but it&#39;s totally normal to wait on hold for 10 minutes to place an order, then wait at the restaurant 10-15 minutes LONGER than the amount of time they tell you your order will take. Doesn&#39;t seem like they&#39;re lacking any staff because there is usually a half dozen people standing around chatting and doing nothing while 3 or 4 people look like they&#39;re running around like crazy trying to get everything together. I&#39;m writing this review while I&#39;m on hold, it&#39;s been 7 minutes and it&#39;s the second time I&#39;m calling trying to order, c&#39;mon guys! Food is great but the wait is insane **UPDATE** Keisha just answered and instead of just transferring me she took my order and was really nice and helpful, thanks girl!!
Understaffed. Waited forever to get our drinks and then meals.  We are here at an off hour too!  Between lunch and dinner!   Won&#39;t do this again!

Love the food and cheesecake selections. Yes, the menu is a book thick.<br><br>::Ambiance::<br>A normal Cheesecake Factory setup and there was no wait at all.<br><br>::Food::<br>Surprisingly they have pretty good fish and chips, minus the fries. Fish was very crispy. I just love the Fresh Strawberry cheesecake.<br><br>::Service::<br>The staff can put on a bit more of smile on their faces. Bases our waitress forgot to bring the beer, everything else was pretty good.<br><br>::Fun Fact::<br>They have a fire place in the back, which is very hard to find.<br><br>Would have the cheesecake again. I really want to try all of their cheesecakes one day.

If I could rate no star, I would. Last night was HORRIBLE. We called my pick up order in around 7:45pm and were still waiting well after 8:15pm for my food. Not only did the guy at the front counter try flirting with me, he basically called me FAT! Saying he &#34;loves a full-figured woman!&#34; <br>To think that was it, doesn&#39;t explain the half. I drove all the way back to central jersey to enjoy my chicken parm sandwich, to find an object in it! Photos attached. My friend called last night to complain to the manager, and was placed on hold TWICE, then when he finally spoke to someone, he was brushed off. Like what kind of service is this, and who is running this establishment?! Cheesecake Factory used to be good, and the service was great a few years ago, but overtime, it&#39;s become a huge disappointment. I wasn&#39;t pleased with the service nor my food, obviously. I don&#39;t think they&#39;ll EVER get any business from me, again.

I love the food and cheesecakes but was upset because we had a 2 1/2 hour wait this pass friday. It was a birthday group of 15 : we called the day before to find out If we need to make reservations or maybe come in early because the group size and they stated no it should be fine to seat us all. Of course we waited because had everyone there but they should allow reservations for large groups.

Over the past week I&#39;ve ordered a few times over the phone for pick up and the staff make it impossible to place an order. As soon as you call they put you on hold indefinitely! It take 3-4 calls to get someone to take your order and you have to  request a manager before your taken care of...the frustrating part is they are not busy! It&#39;s a Monday night and the mall is slow but cheese cake factory obviously doesn&#39;t care about their customer. I shouldn&#39;t have to ask for a manager every time I want to place a pick up! <br><br>Negatives stars if I could rate it
