Let me start with the positive points. When we arrived, there was only a 5 mins wait. For me, it was the fastest seating I have experienced at any Cheesecake Factory location. The food was decent, as usual the menu has lots of options for everyone. However, the service was awful. I ordered a kids pasta &amp; meatball dish, and when the runner brought it out I asked her if she can please bring an extra plate. She rolled her eyes with a major attitude and said &#39;ok&#39;. If I should have asked my waiter instead, she could have communicated that to me. However, the plate I asked for NEVER arrived! I will not return to this location!

This was a frustrating experience.  The food was pretty good- but the service was terrible.  We waited a long time for everything- &amp; they didn&#39;t even seem to be very busy when we got there.  Our server didn&#39;t bring the things we requested (2nd round of drinks &amp; ketchup for a burger) &amp; after waiting 15 minutes I had to go to the kitchen to get the ketchup myself.  The 2nd round took 20 minutes, &amp; everyone was done with their food by then.  Then, she took the leftover pizza to box it- &amp; we waited so long for it to come back that I had to go find that too.  I think we&#39;ll go to the Summit Diner next time.

Terrible experience at this Cheesecake Factory in Short Hills , NJ . Went on a slow Sunday afternoon ,  saw many empty tables. Still had to wait a half hour to be seated.  We knew what we wanted when we sat down so ordered right way.   Other diners near us were heard to comment that they were still waiting for their drinks while their meals were served.  Finally fifty minutes later our food arrived ... in horrendous shape. My turkey burger was falling apart and minuscule and my partners alfredo dish was literally a plate of glued  together cold  pasta.  My beet salad looked like what was left AFTER you finished your meal.  Got up and went to the front, said to the person in charge we couldn&#39;t eat this and was met with the response &#39;ok&#39;. So after wasting a good 2 hours I decided to email the company and got a phone response which was very nice offering to get back to me about the problem.  So after no response after that I called again and it seemed as if the whole thing was forgotten! Again I was promised a response.  What I got was a ridiculous gift certificate that was totally inadequate.  Makes me conclude this restaurant doesn&#39;t understand customer service AT ALL. The waste of my time was not appreciated by them at all.<br><br>And they clearly DO NOT understand our frustration because if they did they would make an honest effort to repair the damage. Cannot believe how tone deaf they are!!

It&#39;s dark, it&#39;s noisy, the tables are relatively close together, the servers are tough to flag down, but... if you are a vegetarian and you&#39;re looking for the best Impossible Burger, this is where to find it. I have eaten them at Bare Burger in NYC, Houlihan&#39;s in Parsippany (second best), White Castle in East Brunswick and at The Office in Morristown. The Impossible Burger here is larger, juicier, and dressed perfectly. The fries aren&#39;t so bad either.

Everyone knows about the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I&#39;ve always stopped by and gotten the cheesecake there, but never had the pleasure of dining in until this summer.<br><br>Complimentary bread basket: Warm and crusty. You&#39;ll need it for the wait. 4/5<br> <br>Shepherd&#39;s Pie: This dish could feed an entire family of 4 in the old days. There&#39;s ground meat, potatoes, and sauce everywhere. Rich and filling. 5/5<br><br>Steak Diane: The steak was on the tougher side of tender. The mushroom wine sauce could be heartier. 4/5<br><br>Lasagna Verde: Flavorful and chewy, with an artful presentation. 5/5<br><br>Salted caramel cheesecake: Smooth and creamy. You could really taste the salt crystals. 4/5 <br><br>Since it&#39;s THE mall location, it gets super crowded and noisy on the weekends. Expect a 45-min wait to be seated, followed by a 30-min wait for the food. Come hungry and you will walk out well-fed.

Food was OK. Service was OK.  However, on the bill they give you the &#39;suggested gratuity&#39; and the math is done on total of the check with tax.  If the restaurant is going to help me with the math for a gratuity it should be on the sub-total NOT including the tax.  Calculating a gratuity should not be done on the taxed amount.

ordered on door dash and didn&#39;t get what i ordered.  took way longer than anticipated.  don&#39;t order cheesecake factory on doordash - the short hills cheesecake factory doesn&#39;t seem to be able to handle the incremental volume.
I liked their omlette and also the cheese pizza. The guacamole salad was delicious. The ambience is really nice.

The worst service. Waited 10 minutes to take our order. Waited 10 minutes for my salad dressing which I had to get up and ask for for a second time. Drink refills after we we&#39;re done with our meals. I won&#39;t be returning.

My husband called to order me a bday cake night of 12/14/17 bc i told him i wanted an oreo cheesecake, he called and asked for a small oreo cheesecake, the lady said that, that isn&#39;t an option and they only have a big one (which is a lie, bc i got my husband a small one for his bday) so my husband said okay to the big one bc my bday is the next day. And today we finally opened the box so i could blow my candle, but this is what we see in the box a cheesecake surrounded with paper, and does not even look like a bday cake. It looks like we are going to sell cheesecake. What a disappointment on my bday. We called trying to ask maybe they could give us the one that doesn&#39;t have all this paper but they said no. And they even said that the one we got was a corporate cake. Why did we end up with a corporate cake. LMAO. Too funny. <br>The lady lastnight was definitely a liar and lazy. Smh.<br>Also the manager was no help. He didn&#39;t want to help my husband with his concern. definitely not going to buy cakes for next special occasion in this location, we might get a corporate one again  <br>the one in menlo park mall is better.

Yummm had the turkey burger and a side salad, it was gluten free and so flavorful.  My dish along with my friend&#39;s enormous mexi-salad was only $34.00.  Lots of food for a reasonable price.  Cheesecake Factory is always consistent &amp; I love their huge selection on the menus.

what an experience! August 8th we decided to have dinner here....<br>I have been going to cheesecake factory for years (coconut grove fla. up to Niagara falls locations) and this has to be one of the worst experiences I have had.  The service was horrible! <br>we ordered appetizers (Thais lettuce wraps) and they never came.  the server never took any accountability and instead blamed the cook...so much for team work....he was barely apologetic and breezed off aloof somewhere else.  Usually cheesecake factory is excellent with service recovery....not this day....never saw a manager....<br>we were so turned off that we decided to leave without dessert.  we asked for the bill and it was lobbed on the table without a folder.  the waiter took forever to return so we decided to get up and try to pay at the cheesecake counter.  unfortunately the fellow there said he couldn&#39;t accept it....this is when we saw the waiter looking for us and handed him the payment. just a horrible experience period...

Take out service has diminished terribly since my last visit to this location. <br>The staff totally ignores you until it is time to take your payment. <br>Everyone seems to busy with their own life to acknowledge a takeout customer.

I love going to the Cheesecake Factory after work for a drink or for lunch. They have a huge menu with options for everyone. I really like their skinnylicious menu because it&#39;s healthier and has smaller portions. My all time favorite bartender is Christine, she is the best! They don&#39;t take reservations so, that can be annoying with a large group. It gets very crowded during dinner time especially Thursday- Sunday. Their portions from the regular menu are huge so, you can definitely share. Same with their Cheesecake slices. There&#39;s parking right outside Cheesecake and in other parts of the mall.

mehhhh.....<br>1. Wait waaaa-a-aaaay too long. [can&#39;t possibly see why anyone would ever come back here]<br>2. Appetizers seemed to be of the store-bought frozen variety type.<br>3. Asked for crispy fries, they came out limp, desperately requiring a dose of Sildenafil Citrate and more heat.<br>4. Brown Rice EXTREMELY undercooked<br>Our waiter was attentive and sincerely apologetic - - I blame 100% of the negativity of this review on the Kitchen Staff, Cooks &amp; Head Chef. I don&#39;t expect them to EVER change ANYTHING about this place as long as they&#39;re extended 50+ minute lines waiting to get inside of what used to be a good establishment. I don&#39;t get it!

I used to enjoy going to the Cheesecake Factory and would often wait the ridiculously long times to get a table after shopping.  However, the food and service quality levels have plummeted over recent years.  It&#39;s like the staff knows that there are limited restaurant choices and they just don&#39;t give a damn.<br><br>I got the lunch portion of the pasta carbonara and my companion got the salmon lunch special.   We asked repeatedly for knives through the meal ... finally got one at the end, yay!  I had to ask 3x for parmesan cheese and when I attempted to flag down a server .... any server, I got major eye avoidance.  Apparently, teamwork is not a principle here ... every waiter is out for himself.<br><br>Food was mediocre and quite frankly, not worth the aggravation.  Carbonara sauce was too watery for my taste.  <br><br>The only time I got any sort of decent service is when I asked for the check.  Surprise and totally cliche.  Wish my experience had been better.

I really like the food here and they have alot of good choices but the wait is always long and I feel like they make you stand around and wait for a table to give the appearance of being alot more busy than they really are. Service and seating process need vast improvement but than again it is The Cheesecake Factory.

Not the worst, but not the best... here&#39;s why:<br><br>Pro&#39;s: as always, lots of choices of food and drink, the service is pretty quick (please note-we sat at the bar on a Saturday early evening for dinner), and it&#39;s convenient.<br><br>Con&#39;s: because it&#39;s attached to the mall, expect it to be packed, filled with kids/babies/families, and it was not only dark inside, but really dirty (floors had chunks of food and the counters were a mess).  <br><br>Pretty much you get what you pay for here... just wish it was up kept a little more.

&#34;Why you gotta fight with me at cheesecake, you know I luh to go there!&#34; - Drake. <br><br>Yeah I had to haha. Anyway, the famous cheesecake factory is so damn good I don&#39;t know why I haven&#39;t tried it sooner. It&#39;s pretty straight forward All-American chain restaurant with huge portions and delicious food omg. I had a bacon burger with a simple salad and iced tea. It was sooooo packed like geez, we waited 30 minutes which isn&#39;t too long but it is seems like forever when you&#39;re hungry as hell. My aunts and I were seated promptly, the waitress was bubbly and the food was 100% on point. For starters we had fried calamari (AHHHHH sea alien) and warm complimentary bread with butter on the side. Afterward, I had a godiva cheesecake which I didn&#39;t really like that much because I prefer plain cheesecake but I decided to be adventurous. Ugh, everything was so tasty. I finally understand why this restaurant is so popular.

I feel like the food has gone downhill, and mind you I&#39;ve been coming here since this location has opened. The food just always leaves something to be desired and also is very bland. I&#39;m not sure what the real problem is but I guess you can blame the managers and the owners for poor food quality. Tonight I ordered something as simple as a Greek salad and the dynamite shrimp and I gotta tell you I was not pleased. I ordered online and these people couldnt follow simple directions. The saving grace is obviously just the cheesecakes because they clearly dont make them there.

Food is consistently good but service has dropped WAY off. Service use to always be awesome. Now the attitudes of the servers are &#34;Meh&#34;. A big no-no in the restaurant biz is the customer having to wait and wait for an initial greeting from the server , even if it&#39;s a &#34;Hi ! I be right over to get your drink order&#34;. At Cheesecake it is now wait wait wait. Drink service is slow with our 3 beverages coming at 3 different times. God forbid you need a refill/ second round. Wait time for apps and entrees is fine but oddly enough , desserts can take longer to come out than the entree ! I mean - how long does it take to slice a piece of cheesecake ??? <br><br>I don&#39;t know if this is a chain wide problem or just at Short Hills but it is very noticeable the last 4-5 times we visited. I keep going back  for the food but it can be an ordeal.

Our son works at the Mall at Short Hills and I was looking forward to Mother&#39;s Day brunch before he had to go into work.  My husband ordered his favorite, Eggs Benedict and asked our server Alex for the eggs to be soft and runny as it should be.  When the runner brought it out, the eggs were hard cooked.  The runner brought it back and within seconds, new eggs were put on top. They too were hard cooked.  We asked for a separate poached egg and and egg came back loaded it with hollandaise sauce.  It was disgusting. We asked for the manager who took the dishes back and offered my husband another meal.  I insisted that he eat something and he asked for 2 scrambled eggs.  We got to the restaurant at 10 am.  We were promptly seated and then the kitchen messed up a simple dish.  3x!  If the eggs cannot be served runny than please tell the servers to ask the guest to pick another dish.  My Mother&#39;s Day meal was ruined as I watched my husband get disappointed and upset each time. My son&#39;s omelette was perfect.  It would&#39;ve been a better choice had we known of the kitchen&#39;s limitations.  <br><br>Re: Cheesecake Factory&#39;s response: please reread my original post. I DID speak to a manager while we were still there.

Nothing ruins your dinner more than bad service.  Unfortunately that was our experience tonight.  The wait was a reasonable 15min to be seated.  We patiently waited for appetizers when out came my son&#39;s burger.  The waiter had forgotten to put in the order for the appetizer.  Never mind.  5 mins. Later 2 more dinners came out.  Several more minutes later my dinner finally came.    Took a while for waiter to come asking if we wanted dessert.  Disappointing experience.
Terrible service. The waitress wouldn&#39;t even be bothered to come back with the bread we asked for or to refill our water glasses. Never again

If this app would take 0 stars I would have done that. I&#39;m still recovering from food poisoning from last night. This place is awful in every way. Service was terrible, food made me soooooo sick. Prices are exorbitant. Heed my advice and Stay Away!!

What started out as a nice family outing with my boyfriends family went bad really quickly!! We met the family at the restaurant from shopping in the mall. When we sat the rest of them had already gotten drinks. It&#39;s started with our waiter not asking for our drink options. I asked for a glass of wine. Then he left for about ten minutes and came back with water. I asked about my wine. 5 minutes later he came back but no wine. We said can we order &#34;please let us&#34;. We all ordered and he finally brought my wine after. <br><br>Two people had to leave so it was 4 remaining. Another 30 minutes came and our entrees still had not come out. But we ate more and more bread. Finally, the food started to come. 2 plates, 4 minutes later another plate, finally 5 minutes later the last plates came and we asked one to be wrapped for the person who had to leave. It was time to eat. Well I got garlic pasta with shrimp. this was supposed to have asparagus, but no asparagus. So then I asked for asparagus from another waiter. <br><br>Then our actual waiter actually came back. I felt the pasta and it was cold, not a little warm , fully cold, so he took the pasta back. Then the missing asparagus came. I thought ok I can eat that. It was cold, refrigerator cold, and I was like I&#39;m done. I grabbed the waiter and said to just cancel. It was enough incompetence for a night. When I asked the waiter to feel the asparagus he was embarrassed. He then walked away after I told him to cancel. He came back 10 minutes later and asked if the manager had come yet. She did not. Her name is Susan Luca. She did not come. Then the waiter asked if we wanted anything. I said yes, just get me wine. 10 minutes later it came. <br><br>Now if you are already mad, that sucks. The waiter came back again, We said we want menus to see about possible deserts, he left to get them. 10 minutes passed, and in that time I got a menu from the waiter station in front of our table. Then more time passed so we asked another waitress to get the manager.  She said ok and came right back and said Susan was with another table. So we asked her to get our check. Once we got it, guess what was still on it? My cold food I sent back and the glass of wine I wanted in its place. Now maybe not the wine, but as pissed as we were, take off the item we sent back. Nothing was offered to make up for it. So we waited longer. <br><br>The waiter came back ten minutes later with menus. We said we were done and why did it take him so long to get menus. We said forget desert we need the manager to take off the meal. He said under his breath, &#34;she didn&#39;t remove it yet&#34;. I actually felt bad for this kid.  It was possibly the worst service &amp; management I have seen. We asked asked for the manager Susan who never came before to come. <br><br>Then finally after everyone was boiling and no manager and no real check, we did the math and took the dish off ourselves and left cash. As we were walking out, the manager Susan finally graced us with her incompetent presence. She&#39;s the worst! Came over slowly, no hustle. At this point there was nothing to say. We already took the food off, we all wanted to leave and I was starving. I told her to take the check and we already took the dish off ourselves. That this place sucks and we will never return.<br><br>She then turned to the waiter and said &#34;some people don&#39;t know how to talk to others&#34;. Well you are right lady! After waiting over 40 minutes for you to come over and not eating, I don&#39;t want to talk to you. After meeting this woman, I don&#39;t blame the kitchen or the waiter I blame her. She runs the restaurant while managing and clearly doesn&#39;t know what she is doing.<br><br>I have managed, waited and bartended at many places and I have never seen a more incompetent lazy manager in my life. We will never be back to this establishment and we will tell everyone we know!

I have never felt more rushed and not wanted in my life. From the moment I walk in I got the impression I was bothering the staff. The hostess was very unfriendly, the server was clearly having a bad day and the bus person gave me an attitude over 2 waters!!! I am in the business and was appalled at the way I was treated....i am spending my hard earned money on this place and they have the Nerve to be bothered by a customers presence???? I can only imagine what management must be like. Me nor anyone I know will ever eat at a Cheesecake Factory again I can promise you that.

Let me preface this with the fact that I am a HUGE Cheesecake Factory fan, which is why our dining experience at this location today made me so sad. Overall, it felt like none of the people working there had any desire to be there which was reflected in the attitude towards customers and the overall vibe of the place. <br><br>When we arrived we were seated fairly quickly, but it took over 10 minutes for us to get a high chair brought over to our table. Placing our order took at least 15-20 minutes after sitting down (we had to flag someone down multiple times), and the waitress then proceeded to come back and ask a ton of questions that we had already answered about our order. She also forgot our side. <br><br>Food was good and fairly priced, but honestly the total lack of customer service made this such a distasteful experience that we are going to start trying some of the other eatery options at the Short Hills Mall.

I got the Pasta Da Vinci, which is hands down my favorite dish. I recommended it to my friends and 4 of them ended up getting it as well.<br><br>The pasta is penne with a wine sauce, chicken, and mushroom. It&#39;s $16.95 and I always have enough to take home. Portions are huge! Definitely worth trying.<br><br>We came here for my friends&#39; birthdays and I told the waiter that it was their birthdays and he awkwardly said &#34;ok&#34; and didn&#39;t say anything else. So I thought he weren&#39;t going to do anything for my friends. After our meal, he didn&#39;t offer to get the check after he asked if we wanted cheesecake, which we didn&#39;t, and he and another waiter came out with small birthday sundaes in shot glasses for my two friends. Nice surprise for their birthdays. :)<br><br>Yeah it&#39;s noisy, but I&#39;m fine with that. It&#39;s a classy atmosphere in a nice mall with portions relative to the price (aka higher than normal). <br><br>I didn&#39;t get cheesecake this time but their cheesecakes are fabulous. Definitely recommend the tiramisu, pumpkin, and red velvet.

Have recently discovered CF. Very pleasant staff, food choices are wide, my Cosmo was outstanding.<br>I think the uniforms are not in keeping with the quality of the place, but who am to have an opinion?<br>Have only had great experiences here.

I always have a great experience at almost any Cheesecake Factory location! For breakfast, I love their waffles and for lunch/dinner I love the four cheese pasta! I have never witnessed a wait here longer than 5-10 minutes even on weekend breakfast days, or weekend evenings. Their service is very quick and the menu has a great variety, there&#39;s some for everyone. It&#39;s a lovely place and the mall itself is my favorite. Perfect for a bite after a long day of shopping!

I went for happy hour and sat in the bar area. I got the chicken taquitos, sweet corn tamale cakes, factory nachos, and korean fried cauliflower. I enjoyed it all, the tamale cakes were sweet, chicken tosquitos were crispy, hot, and fresh with lots of flavor. The cauliflower looked and tasted like sweet sesame chicken. However, the service was lacking a little because the waiter took a long time to come to our table to take our order and refill the water. He was&#39;nt a bad guy just the service was not what I&#39;m used to when I normally eat here. That&#39;s why I&#39;m giving it 3 stars for the service.

Just bought $900 worth of gift cards to score the 2 free slices For every $25 spent and now my tale of woe.  We bought these cards at the Christiana Mall in Delaware and we travel to NJ to visit family after Thanksgiving and usually about once a month. I have to say that the Short Hills location PALES next to the Christiana Mall In Delaware in both food and especially in service. We eat out too much and we have tried a ton of menu items and know what is good.<br><br>The service in Short Hills is not very good, servers do not seem well trained and it is a bit chaotic for no reason. Every time I ask them not to over cook the Miso Salmon. It comes out rock hard and I choke it down so I don&#39;t have to wait for another one. This is not a hard thing to do, Christiana Mall usually gets it right. Why have fresh salmon that comes out dry like canned tuna? It is just a few minutes less cook time, or an experienced line cook.<br><br>The best Cheesecake Factory is in San Fran across from the St Francis hotel. The staff and the kitchen is top notch and cooks fish perfectly, so it CAN be done. Short Hills could do so much better with better training and staff!

Oh my lordie, I&#39;m reppin&#39; chains hard lately. I went here yesterday with the future M.I.L before a bit of a shopping trip at Short Hills Mall. I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake in like a decade, so it&#39;s been a while.<br><br>This one at Short Hills is BUSY! All the stay at home moms lunching with each other with some serious strollers clogging the passage ways. <br><br>This Cheesecake is no different than the million others. Yet this one lacked any sort of personal charm through great service. The hostess was kind of rude, we weren&#39;t offered any bread, which is fine, the waitress was alright, nothing special, pretty non existent. <br><br>My skinnylicious Asian Chicken Salad was HUGE, filling and at $13 wasn&#39;t too badly priced, but really didn&#39;t taste like anything.<br><br>If you&#39;re at Short Hills Mall and don&#39;t mind chaos and looking for a filling meal, Cheesecake is most definitely your spot.

This probably has been an OK experience. The food was okay not the best. I ordered the fish and chips and it was mushy wasn&#39;t even fresh. The pasta was kind of dry. Overall my waiter wasn&#39;t the best I asked him for water for about 3-4 times and he forgot. I don&#39;t recommend this cheesecake factory maybe the problem was that they&#39;re busy, but overall it was bad.

This has got to be my favorite Cheesecake Factory location! I&#39;ve been to other locations, but this one is definitely the best. Even though it&#39;s the same food, the chef makes it better at this location. I love their chicken piccata served with angel hair pasta. Their peach bellinis are AMAZING!! They taste like candy...just like peach sour rings. Their service is good too; the servers are always friendly. I&#39;ve been here for my birthday a few times, and I have not been disappointed. Amazing food, and a great atmosphere. As you can tell, I would definitely recommend this location!

This place doesn&#39;t deserve ANY stars... what an aweful service. And the Mgr keeps a blind eye to the problems. I will make sure that none of my friends, business associates and clients will NEVER go there.<br>Too much incompetence. it really Sucks.<br>I was going to write what happened..but where do I start...  the service has been constantly bad... orders wrong or never placed.. wrong drinks.. even alcohol in a minors smoothy...  SUCKS BIG TIME

Horrible. Save your time and money! Burger meat came out cold and the cheese wasn&#39;t even melted. It looked like a frozen patty that wasn&#39;t fully cooked. The pasta I ordered were all stuck together and not fully cooked either. The linguine came out in chunks and it was doughy. Even the free bread they give you in the beginning sucked. It was cold and no sourdough. Service was good but the food seriously could have been A LOT better. The Cheesecake Factory at Riverside Mall is so much better.

This place is such a tragedy to be called part of the short hills mall. The staff is rude and uneducated about what the restaurant offers. They also only take reservations on a M-Th, which is fine, but I had to call and got placed on hold 4 different times because the staff isn&#39;t properly trained. <br><br>The fact that this is at short hills and they can&#39;t find better people to manage the restaurant and their employees is unacceptable. I expect better from this area, even if it is a chain.

Sadly, I had high hopes considering the wait-staff was very friendly and prompt from when I sat down.  The appetizer tuna tartare was maybe a 2.5/3-star. Definitely some tuna taste there but seemed to have a lot of bread crumbs, a total sucker punch.... <br><br>The main entree is where everything really fell short. I ordered the Bang-Bang Chicken and Shrimp and ordered it extra spicy.... This is a thai curry dish.. that is supposed to be spicy to begin with. I received the dish and it did have the shrimp, chicken and rice on the plate.  The sauce was no where near what curry is.   This had the flavor or a dessert.... very sweet, I actually had to ask for hotsauce.  <br><br>As I was eating, turns out the dish was made with cinnamon apples!  Yes you read that correctly, apples.... in a Thai curry dish.   This dish was not at all what it is cracked up to be in the description.  Whether the kitchen screwed up royally or if this is the standard.... its very misleading at the best or an utter failure at the worst. <br><br>Will I come back here... probably not....

Ordered through DoorDash and couldn&#39;t be more pleased! The Southwest Chicken Sandwich was UNBELIEVABLE.  I ordered several things off the menu for a friend and I to share and everything was exactly as ordered.  Received my food in almost half the time that I anticipated.  I couldn&#39;t say more about everything we received and my experience ordering online.  Definitely a new favorite of mine!!

I knew it would eventually happen, but this chain is no longer the gold standard for mall restaurants.  The service is fair, the food is fair, and the menu even more complicated.  The server forgot spoons, didn&#39;t refill sodas, etc.  A bit too casual - as if training has been overlooked.  As for the food, the quality just wasn&#39;t there.  Corn dogs tasted long frozen, lettuce wraps were pre-made (as opposed to letting you make it yourself as before), etc.  Desert was still very good, but you&#39;d expect that.  Overall, this chain and location have lost a bunch of steps, and I doubt they&#39;ll reclaim them anytime soon.

Perfect spot to grab a quick after shopping drink. I love to sit at the bar and order a blue cheese olive dirty martini. Went here last night after a long day of shopping and it really hit the spot. They have a &#34;skinny menu&#34; that makes it so easy to order healthy and guilt free. The service is always good here. And I love the warm bread they give you before your food comes out! I split the four cheese Pasta with shrimp with my friend and it was more than enough for 2. The best part was the giant pile of ricotta cheese on the middle! They also come around with fresh parmigiana cheese In case the 4 cheeses isn&#39;t enough! I will definitely be back after my next shopping trip

Just another standard Cheesecake Factory.  I prefer the one in Willowbrook Mall...it is much bigger, and the wait staff is more attentive.  Unfortunately the wait time for Willowbrook Mall is always much worse than this on at Short Hills Mall...

Just an awful experience over the weekend.  Unfortunately, this wasn&#39;t the first bad experience at this location.  <br><br>The whole meal got off to a bad start when we ordered water for the four of us, and 10 minutes later, had to remind the server to bring them over.  10 minutes after that, we are wondering where are appetizer is and we were told by our server that it would come in 3 minutes.  Well, two of our four main courses came out in 5 minutes, along with our appetizer.  10 minutes later, we get the manager to come over to see what is going on and he says this is &#34;simply unacceptable.&#34;  Your telling me! Soon the two other entrees arrive.  <br><br>My wife orders some shrimp and rice dish, and the rice is cold and hard, and the shrimp is scalding hot.  Can&#39;t you just stick the whole dish in the microwave? <br><br>All they did for us was take the appetizer off the bill.  <br><br>I miss Joe&#39;s American Grill already.  Hopefully Short Hills Mall can find a decent replacement for them because this Cheesecake Factory is a huge disappointment.  <br><br>Oh - and they no longer serve the crispy crab wontons.  As if there&#39;s any other reason never to visit this restaurant again...

This is the all too well know chain. I&#39;m sure everyone has been to one at some point. The calorific menu is a gut buster if you don&#39;t watch it. Food quality is good for what it is. Plenty of items on the menu from salads to hamburgers. Their Cheesecakes are good but in moderation. I think the lettuce cups are one of the best options on the menu. Still plenty of food but you won&#39;t walk out feeling disgusted and maybe even able to share a slice of cheesecake.

Good food but way too long of a wait. Came in and waited over an hour for a table for 4. Probably on the smaller side compared to other cheesecake factories but still a large restaurant. By the way, I&#39;ve never seen so many strollers by the exit. Is that a fire-hazard?

Maybe this experience was out of the ordinary but it was a strange enough experience that I have to yelp it.<br> <br> First off the table looked like it was in the middle of being cleaned. Missing napkins and utensils. Our hostess kicks a crooked chair back into place and seats us. We had to pull stuff off of another table. Also the napkins shed like crazy.<br><br> Next was food. Veggie burger was sold out and our waiter let us know a little far into my boyfriends dish being made so he was going to get his food first. Not a complaint about the waiter he was fine. I tried to order another item and it was sold out too.. annoying? But I ordered something finally it was available. My boyfriend ordered a burger and added bacon and got no bacon no problem he didn&#39;t even charge for it so he must&#39;ve forgot all together.<br><br>Overall the food is always pretty good! It&#39;s consistent within the chain. My Mac and cheese balls could have been warmer and were cold in the middle.<br><br>The strangest part of our experience was the two tables next to us were celebrating birthdays. There is a women who works at the short hills location who SINGS her heart out.. Talented yes, but necessary no.<br>We were sitting next to a POS unfortunately and we heard her co workers making fun of her and saying how it&#39;s &#34;not American idol&#34;. And the teams personal conversations became our main entertainment for our dinner. It was very odd and distracting. Apparently she must do that often.<br><br>Once the place started clearing out it was us and a table of teenagers left in the back to fend for ourselves. Wait staff m.i.a. The teenagers were throwing ice cubes at the tables next to us for whatever reason. <br><br>I felt like I was on another planet. It was not a normal Cheesecake Factory experience that I&#39;m used to.

This restaurant is amazing the service is very good and friendly and they are there for your every need. The food is cooked to perfection and is reasonably priced. The cheesecake selection is very big and the cheesecake itself is amazing. All throughout the menu it is filled with flavorful cheesecakes and main courses. I overall recommended to everyone. Great atmosphere.

Came here on a Thursday night with two friends. We were told by the person at the front that the wait was 15 min they gave us a buzzer for when to come back to the front to be seated. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks in the meantime. About 25 min go by, our buzzer did not go off. Our friend walked to the front and the person said &#34;we called your name and you didn&#39;t show up&#34; then what is the point in having a buzzer if you are going to shout people&#39;s names? Finally we get seated after 40 min. Our waitress was fake friendly and you could tell she hates her job. We ordered 3 dishes. Only ended up with two. We didn&#39;t bother to mention it to the server because she completely forgot. The food was bland and not to mention the floor is extremely slippery almost as if they poured cooking grease all over the floor. surprised they haven&#39;t had a lawsuit yet. Will never be returning here.

I believe my servers name was Josh.<br><br>He was very attentive, the food was the same at every other cheesecake factory I&#39;ve been to... GOOD.<br><br>I had a signature extra dirty martini, and it was made to perfection.<br><br>I would definitely return to this location for food and drinks without hesitation.<br><br>I likes the parking arrangements as well. Very close, and with the weather being somewhat chilly, it was a plus for me.<br><br>we were seated right away on a Monday night.

Do you know why I ADORE the Cheesecake Factory? Because they have the biggest portions Iv ever seen in a chain restaurant and it is honestly life changing....(*_*)<br><br>My absolute favorite is there cheesecake cake of course... The strawberry cheesecake is very good....plane cheesecake topped with fresh strawberries! Sweetest strawberries ever! <br><br>My suggestion is for you to order one piece to share there... then get another flavor to take home..... The cheesecake will last for several days in the fridge....and (if you can control yourself!) you take just a few bites every night.....Just right! <br><br>As for food....the chicken madeira is pretty good... as well as the avocado spring rolls! Delish! <br><br>The menu is HUGE.... so I would suggest going to their website in advance and taking a look....It takes forever to decide on what to eat! <br><br>I would of gave this place four stars but due to the fact this location is smaller then the other cheesecake factor Iv been to by Menlo Park Drive...it felt somewhat cramped here....The seating are defiantly tighter! the wait to be seated is regardless...especially on the weekends...<br><br>Oh.... one more thing! The table bread (the darker one) that they bring you is soft...only the brown ones though!! just Don&#39;t eat too much bread! enjoy and have a lovely meal! ;D!

Came here for a late lunch and got seated right away. Ordered  the meat loaf and fish and chips. Finished off with a strawberry cheesecake for dessert. Can&#39;t go wrong with the cheesecakes here!<br><br>The meat loaf was pretty tasty, but I can make a much better one. I really liked the mushroom gravy that they topped the mashed potatoes with. The fish was damn good and crispy. <br><br>Also had the chicken sandwich recently, which was really crispy, delicious, and filling. At $12, it&#39;s a relatively good deal, and will probably be my go to lunch item whenever I come here from now on. <br><br>The waitress forgot to bring out my beer, and some of the silverware and napkins were a bit grimy. Had to knock this place down a star.

Omg..chaos reigned supreme....I have never seen a restaurant run like this. We went for brunch on sunday..not too crowded. We had to wait about 15 minutes..our beeper went off signaling that a table was ready, we went to the host and handed him the gizmo and stood there for another 15 minutes..until we said something and reminded him that we were waiting. We were taken to our table, supplied with menus and waited and waited and waited...the table/booth was set for 6.we were 4, the other two settings were never removed. we ordered and waited and waited and waited...after 1/2 hour, the server brought two of the four orders, and we waited and waited and waited...she brought coffee with no milk or sweetener.....so after getting a hold of another server, she brought a couple of packs of sugar and a tiny amount of milk in a plastic cup...not enough to change the color of the terrible tasting coffee..we had to flag her down for more.and by then the coffee was cold..after 15 minutes, our breakfasts were delivered....!.one of my friends asked fo r a refill of water ..so the server refilled his water and despite the left without asking or filling the other glasses that were obviously empty...when my buddy politely said that the coffee was terrible...the server told him, not in a nasty way, yeah it is bad, if i got you another cup it would be just as bad...this is not starbucks......yikes......waste of money waste of time disgusting in every way.......very poorly managed, staff not well trained or not trained at all...very unpleasant not worth subjecting ourselves to this kind of service...message to Cheesecake Factory Management...you really need to get your corporate quality assurance people down to this place...I have never written this in any restaurant review but you&#39;ve got a serious problem at the Short Hills Cheesecake Factory...corroborated by many of the other reviews that basically say the same thing.
Average service but speedy. Very friendly staff but food did not come out hot. Great portions and so many choices. I sat at the bar so there was no specific interaction with a server.

Unfortunately not worth the wait!  We were in that restaurant for almost three hours.  I understand it was a busy night, maybe have more staff in hand.  Our server was barely attentive  to our table.  I was so frustrated, I would not even let my kids get the cheesecake.  Waited a long time to try and order it so just gave up.  Our food did not even come out together.  My daughter was the last to be served a side salad!  Her salad came about ten minutes after the rest of us had our meal and that salad was her meal.<br>I should of known after calling and the the phone ringing forever that going there was not going to be a good idea.  Never again.

Service was AWFUL!  We waited over 20 minutes to even be acknowledged by our server.  Finally, a lovely young lady, Chianti, noticed us sitting there and took our drink order.  We asked if she could be our server but the manager refused.  You can get better service at a Burger King drive through!  Our daughter fell on oil on her way to the ladies room.  We flew up from Florida to surprise our grandchildren for our grandson&#39;s birthday and it turned out to be a disaster.  We wrote corporate three times and they didn&#39;t even have the decency to respond.  Even though we WERE regulars we will NEVER return to this awful location again.  As a result of corporates unprofessionalism, we won&#39;t be going to any location.  Our only advice is run don&#39;t walk away from this restaurant!

Extremely slow service, waitress never came to ask how food was (if she did she would have noticed we needed refills. We had to ask another waitress for more drinks. The floors were so greasy, I slipped going into the bathroom where I was met by disgusting conditions and no hand soap...how can employees wash their hands without soap!? Never returning to this Cheesecake Factory.

UPDATE: As you can see from the comments posted by The Cheesecake Factory, they are trying to pin this experience on DoorDash, when clearly as stated by me, the issue was with the food prepared at The Cheesecake Factory. There is no need for me to contact DoorDash as they delivered the food item just fine. There is no way DoorDash can check the quality of food The Cheesecake Factory hands over to them.<br>------------------------------------------------<br>Earlier Review: Ordered a salad and avocado egg roll from here which was delivered through DoorDash. No issues on the salad which was enjoyed by my vegetarian friend. However, the avocado egg roll, though delicious had a small piece of stone in it. Ofcourse there was no way I could have known until I had put that piece of egg roll in my mouth. Still trying to scratch my head around how it might have got inside the roll and also raises questions about the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food quality control.<br>Order the avocado egg roll will caution, never know what secret surprise you might find in it.

Nostalgia... why do you deceive me so?<br><br>Cheesecake factory was my go-to place in college back in LA.  We even went there for my farewell party before I left for the East coast, so fond memories were always associated with the place.  So you can imagine my excitement when this place opened, despite the fact that my fond memories were years ago, and I&#39;ve learned a lot more about what food should &#34;really&#34; taste like.<br><br>So coming back to CF, yes the food is generic and formulaic.  Which is okay if you&#39;re here because you&#39;ve been loyal to the place even at your taste bud&#39;s protest.  <br><br>But this time... when you sit and wait for 20 minutes, no one to take your order, not even a glass of water, then try to hail down a waiter for another 5 min, you begin to question your choice of restaurants, your judgement in food, and whether basil belongs in a good cocktail.  And no one, should EVER have to question the deliciousness of basil.<br><br>I think I&#39;ll still visit my old joints in LA, but I won&#39;t be back to this one.<br><br>Sidenote: If you do visit and need to buy a whole cheesecake, note that they come from the freezer. And takes 2-3 hrs to defrost.  No joke, you can save some money buying at Costco.

At the time of this review, this restaurant has an average of 3 stars from 121 reviewers. In my opinion, that is way too low. I was shocked that it isn&#39;t averaging 4.5-5 stars. It&#39;s got everything. Great atmosphere and lighting. Great food. Huge menu with lots of options. Portion sizes are huge - enough for two meals in some cases if you don&#39;t mind leftovers. Fast service. Decent prices. I literally can&#39;t think of anything to complain about. <br><br>We had the made-to-order guacamole. Which was a surprisingly large portion for just $11. Fish and chips, Shepard&#39;s pie and my favorite, Cobb salad. They were all excellent.<br><br>Every Cheesecake Factory I have been to has been the same positive experience. These guys know what they&#39;re doing.

Today was almost the worst Cheesecake Factory experience I ever had. First we had to wait 20 minutes just to get bread and water, then another 40 minutes or more to get our food. After complaining to the manager about the slow service he compensated us with a free slice of cheesecake. I would have rather had my meal on time. FYI they do not have free Wi-Fi that only made the wait worse. I will not be returning to this location. Not to be totally negative the food was okay once it finally arrived

Let me start by saying, my husband and I love Cheesecake Factory. We dine at this franchise often. Sorry bank account! But this was our first time dining at the Short Hills location and it was VERY disappointing and frustrating. At several points, we wanted to get up and leave and I wish we did. It was a weeknight around 8PM so needless to say, it was not crowded at all. When we first arrived, we were completely ignored by the greeters who were busy having their own conversations behind the counter to notice anyone around them. It was awkward waiting around for a chance to interrupt or be acknowledged. Sorry for the inconvenience! Luckily, the manager was nearby, saw what was happening and stepped in. Thanks! After we were seated, the service from staff just got worse. We waited 15-20 minutes for our waitress to introduce herself. 15-20 minutes!?!? We were left wondering if anyone even knew we had just been seated or if there was even someone assigned to our table. Even once our waitress made her grand debut, we had to wait yet again for her to bring out water and bread. How long does it take to get water and bread on a table?! There was just a lack of attentiveness at this location that I have never experienced before. Staff did not know or maybe did not care who was waiting for what. This theme continued up until we got our check but at that point we were just thrilled to be leaving. All in all, the service we got was terribly slow and seemed like the customers were more of an inconvenience than anything. I would not dine at this location again.
Vanessa is great! Great customer service!!! Every time<br>I go in everyone is nice and welcoming and I get taken care of right away. Really representing their brand.

I&#39;ve had the Worse experiences while trying to place an order and picking up a to go order. The service is awful! Your left on hold for an Extremely Long time- Only to be put Back on hold!! Their employees have no concern for return customers not do they care about new customers!They seem to care very little about happy customers altogether!!<br>Each time I ordered I was told the order would be ready in 35 minutes- instead it took 1 1/2 hours and asking for a refund to actually get my order!<br>I used to love to eat here and enjoy several items on their menu- But sad to say I will Never eat here again.

First, I admit it is not exactly fair to review a restaurant in its first week.  But this IS Cheesecake Factory, so you know that even a new one is pretty likely to adhere to the corporate formula.  This is (so far) a welcome addition to the Short Hills Mall, having replaced a Johnny Rockets and some other stores I never shopped at.  It is pretty in that CCF faux-finish way.  <br><br>It was not yet chaotic the Sunday I ate there in its first week, and the food was actually quite tasty, and arrived  in a well-paced, unhurried way.  Our table started with white bean hummus, sliders and (gasp) fried mac-and-cheese balls.  All were quite tasty, especially the latter, which, while utterly delicious, is loathsome from a health perspective.<br><br>We had a variety of salads and pastas.  All were good.  We were all stuffed, so no dessert,  and I am not a big fan of their cheesecake in any event.<br><br>I have a feeling that in the coming weeks this place will be mobbed once word of its opening gets out, so I have no illusions that I will have the patience anytime soon to wait for a table there again.  But I am glad I got to try it early on.

Let me just say that I&#39;m often coined a &#34;Ball-Buster&#34; by my wife because of my &#34;no-bull****&#34; approach to customer service and satisfaction guaranteed policy.<br><br>As a consumer, I do not tolerate mediocre service and disrespect from ANY establishment and whenever I&#39;m displeased, there should be some type of resolve that benefits both parties involved.<br><br>My wife and I dined here last evening. Our food was amazingly good however, I was displeased with the drinks ordered.<br><br>First, I ordered a Mojito. It was completely watered down with no hint of alcohol whatsoever. So when our waiter came, I asked him to take it back and I&#39;ll have a Cosmopolitan instead. Well, the Cosmo arrived and tasted just as crappy as the last disappointment. So, again, I told him that this wasn&#39;t acceptable and could he just bring red wine instead. <br><br>This dude decides to bring the manager on call instead. She politely came over to tell me that they&#39;re not taking the second drink off the tab. I replied: &#34;Well...I&#39;m dissatisfied with your drink service. I ordered red wine as the absolute last resort and I doubt I&#39;ll send it back - as it is wine. I mean, you can&#39;t really screw up wine.&#34; Annoyed, she takes my drink from the table and never says another word. <br><br>Ok. Fine. No drinks. <br><br>We&#39;re ready for the check now. It arrives with the Cosmo on it. I gave the check back and had it removed (it took a while to come back to the table. I guess she was pissed and had to contemplate it for a while).<br><br>Whatever.<br><br>The bill came back correct. We paid and left.<br><br>If you ever visit the cheesecake factory, get plain alcohol with NO ice or just play it safe with wine. You can&#39;t go wrong with it.

Just came here and after waiting 40 mins in the middle of the day waiting for a table had the absolute worst service. Ordered drinks, waitress got them wrong, came back, took our order and then went MIA. Had to hunt her down to ask about our meal after an hour of waiting for a salad and a burger at 2:30p in afternoon. Table next to us had same issue. When we finally saw her again and asked why the food was delayed so long and never got a refill on any drinks/bread, she just said she would get the manager very apathetically. The manager proceeded to tell me that I should have come and got her bc she&#39;s always around and then next time she can do something about it if I tell her sooner- somehow this was our fault for the poor service. Also did I mention we had our 8 month old with us? 8 month old. So yes, my focus should have totally been on getting the staff to do their job. The manager came back with our check and a piece of cheesecake. Not impressed with the service or the managers response to the clear issue with the staff.

Been to this location over 2 or 3 dozen times in the past 7 or 8 years. Had a horrible experience on a Monday night.  Not too busy but once seated it was downhill from there.  Our waitress made us feel very rushed, inattentive and basically avoided eye contact every time she spoke with us. 10 minutes after my wife&#39;s meal arrived we were still waiting for a knife. Totally ignored by the waitress who I guess forgot we asked for it.  While eating my order of Imperial Chicken and Shrimp I was totally grossed out.  <br><br>I found a hair in the sauce. As gross as it sounds, I think i ate part of the hair as I had been slicing my food in the same area I found the hair within the sauce. We notified the waitress who said I&#39;m sorry about that.  She took the plate away.  A few minutes later came back by the table and asked if I wanted another plate made.  Promptly the assistant manager stopped by the table.  She advised me she checked the kitchen and ensured that all employees were wearing the appropriate head coverings.  That response did nothing but make me feel as though I was responsible for the hair in the plate.  <br><br>FYI: I am bald lol - so yea ok.<br>After this, the waitress continued to be dismissive and uninterested in treating us like we were her customers. She never asked if we wanted to see the dessert menu (Isn&#39;t this the Cheesecake Factory?). Dropped off the check and blurted out, &#34;We took both orders off of the bill&#34;. In a snarky tone once again displaying dismissive body language, not making eye contact and walking away briskly before I could say anything. I Still left a nice tip, because I like to give the benefit of the doubt.  Maybe she was having a bad day.<br>Don&#39;t know if I can go back to this location any time soon. I was sick to my stomach the rest of the night.

This is the worst Cheesecake factory ( Short Hills) in NJ. The General Manager is the worst his name is Ralph Strivelli if your white you might have a chance. He Has a nasty attitude and is very unprofessional. He has no customer service skills. Nadine, which works at the front desk thinks she owns the place. Horrible service horrible management. I think they should be closed down.

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory.  Let me start off at the end.  The desserts are fantastic.  We all think the slice of cheesecake is smaller than we used to get.  But, the taste is great.  Linda&#39;s cake is also great.<br><br>The food.  The food is good.  it is not bad and certainly isn&#39;t the best.  I try to stick with chicken marsala, jambalaya and a few other basics.  The bread is always hot and fresh.  The unlimited refills of great lemonades. <br><br>The price point is perfect.<br><br>Now for the rocky part.  The service is hit or miss.  The wait is unbearable.  <br><br>Excellent to go with the kids.  Do not think about going here with a large group.  They really do not have a fair amount of large tables.

Waiting for our waitress and never came by and we ask one of the waiter here she&#39;s said I&#39;m not your waiter in A nasty rude way !!!!!At least say On hold I&#39;ll get her for you but no!!! Waiting almost 15min

I have been a fan of Cheesecake Factory and have eaten here several times at the Short Hills Mall.  Last night i finished my dinner and then saw a cockroach behind my friends head, walking on the edge of he booth, she then told me she saw one walking behind my head on the booth! The manager obviously compt our food, but we had to pay for our wine? It turned my stomach.
Food is good but service is slow and the dishes were dirty.   It is very loud also so not a very enjoyable lunch experience.  One of our lunch entrees came long after the other two and was clod.

This was my first time in any Cheesecake factory, and I&#39;m not planning on returning.<br><br>Like everyone else says, the service is slow and it sucks. Walked in from cold outside, and first thing asked for coffee, it took no less than 15 minutes until I got it. Half way through waiting the waitress came to the table, saying she had to make fresh coffee. The place was mostly empty, a lot of staff was just standing around - nevertheless, inattentive, showing up sporadically. Asking if we want to see dessert menu in a tone like expecting that we&#39;ll say no. Usually, tipping 17-20% I&#39;d have loved to leave 10% just to be polite, definitely felt like 15% was too much. <br>1 appetizer, 2 entrees, 1 cheesecake came to $64. For mediocre food &amp; experience, it was not worth it.<br><br>Left half a cheesecake on the plate - sounded good - nothing special. From 1 to 10, food was 7-8 - meaning it was just food, not &#34;good food&#34; or &#34;great food&#34;.<br>Mashed potatoes were good considering it is almost impossible to find them good tasting anywhere. Shrimp tasted like soap. Avocado spring rolls while good, I was saying at the table, I wouldn&#39;t order them again.<br><br>Not going back.

I have been here 3 times in the past week and I am upset that today, our food took extremely long to get, we were rushing to get to work-- and all the manager on duty said was &#34;sorry, I will talk to the kitchen next time.&#34; Really?? How about compensating me for the poor lack of service??  That&#39;s not how you treat loyal patrons. Tip: please coach management and understand basic sales forecasting-- if it&#39;s busy on a holiday-- it will likely be busy on the same holiday next year-- please staff appropriately.

Adequate. There are very few food options in the mall at the moment and Cheesecake is always fine. You know what to expect: food is alright, nothing spectacular, and the service is alright. The bar area, however, smells like mildew to the point of being unappetizing. It starts to make your food taste off, that&#39;s how strong the smell is. I don&#39;t know where the smell is coming from, but I&#39;m really hoping it&#39;s not behind the bar...

Terrible service. Waiters and waitresses literally avoid eye contact. Didn&#39;t get our table waters until I got up and found someone, who happened to be the manager, to bring them for us. Today is Monday night and the restaurant was not even busy, I don&#39;t understand what these waiters could have been doing but obviously it wasn&#39;t their jobs. <br>The waitress also gave us the wrong food and we waited 10 minutes for her to come to the table and by that time we decided to just eat because we were so hungry from already being there for an hour and a half. <br>It&#39;s such a shame that such a nice restaurant has such poorly trained waiters.

Absolutely terrible restaurant ! The service is slow, the staff is rude. The food is subpar at best. Steak is flavorless the cheese steak came out so tiny on a hard hoagie roll the size of a Taco Bell taco. Our drinks were never refilled one of our kids burgers came out 8 minutes after the rest of the tables food. The waitress never said thank you or please to anything and seemed bothered anytime we asked for anything. The hostess are too busy dancing and texting to acknowledge you. They buzz you 10 mins before your table is ready and leave you standing in everyone&#39;s way. It was our daughters birthday dinner and they brought everyone dessert but hers and waited over 5 minutes to come out singing with hers. I would never come back here.

Will not come back. Waited for an hour for our food after numerous complaints. Pasta finally came but all dried and cold. Spoke to manager, he said they were ready 25 minutes ago but don&#39;t know why waitress didn&#39;t bring them out.
Terrible service and undercooked food. Don&#39;t waste your time. Very surprising considering this place is located in the short hills mall
It&#39;s a chain. It has a ridiculously large menu. It&#39;s in a mall. Prepare to to be underwhelmed.

TOO MANY CHOICES!!!<br><br>All of the food is formulaic.  They make very good salads, but with that many items on the menu, it&#39;s no surprise that most of the dishes are hit and miss.<br><br>Of course, they do make excellent cheesecake.<br><br>I find myself overwhelmed at every visit, simply because the menu reads like a phone book.  I get intimidated...

Friday night at The Cheesecake Factory was unfortunately a disappointment. We accepted the 45 minute wait and waited to be directed to a dark hole of a booth.  Turns out when we look up at the ceiling, the light was out. We politely asked if we can be seated with adequate lighting. Take 2: We are in the booth by the kitchen. It was a 180 differences. Night to day. Literally. We are elated (It&#39;s the simple things in life).  Server takes our order. The hamburger egg rolls came out so fast (less then 5 minutes from ordering) and turns out to be greasy and poorly executed. It was evident the dish was made in a rush as you hold up an evenly halved sloppy egg roll you see grease drippings.  As we wait patiently for entrees, 10 minutes go by. Another 10 minutes. And another. Mind you, we haven&#39;t seen the server or been informed about our MIA entrees. This is turning out to be a long night.  We finally see the server and it&#39;s acknowledged this is a long journey for two salads and a medium rare steak medallion dish. Our dishes have arrived and the medium rare is medium well which was sent back for another 20 minute wait and one of us loses our appetite.  Unbeknownst to us, the manager comes to apologize for the epic wait.  She was professional and comp two of the entrees.  Despite the miscommunications between front and back, the kitchen poorly managed time and execution.  This is a case when the supply couldn&#39;t keep up with the demand on a typical Friday night.
Very good food but extremely slow service. Waiter is very nice, seems that she has too many tables. It took way to long to get our food and desert

I&#39;ve always have a good time at The Cheese Cake Factory but today was the absolute worst. It&#39;s like we were being rush to eat, our waitress placed our orders same time ; appetizers and dinner. I was still having the appetizers when our dinner was placed on the table, which she took up with me in &#39;mid-bite&#39;. I&#39;m most annoyed and appalled my my experience today, it surely did not match up to the superb services I&#39;ve come to know and associate The Cheese Cake Factory with!!!

Just had my daughter&#39;s birthday lunch here.  It was moderately crowded for a Sunday afternoon and our wait for a table was fifteen minutes.  The atmosphere is lively and very loud.  The restaurant is clean and the food a bit pricey.  Our server got us our drinks super quick and bread came out shortly thereafter.  <br><br>The food took a while to come out but we were all happy with our entrees.  The burgers were pretty good, the fried shrimp nice portion size and the gumbo also good.  The cheesecake was half price today - score!  The cheesecake was beautifully plated and tasted super fresh.<br><br>Our server Quasheem was TOP NOTCH!  Attentive and very pleasant personality. <br><br>The staff sang happy birthday to my daughter and let&#39;s just say it was very enthusiastic!  <br><br>We will be back!

Pretty classic meal all around, it&#39;s exactly what you would expect.  It was tasty for sure, but not the best quality you are going to get for the money.<br><br>We had the Avocado Eggrolls to start which were quite good.  The Americana hamburger had great toppings and was cooked as I asked (medium rare) but not he best tasting beef.  And, of course, the cheesecake itself was the best part.  Solid choice for the area.
Wife and I had fish tacos for our meals and a Buffalo chicken blast app. Food and service was good an enjoyed eating on the patio. Took a slice of plain cheesecake home and wasn&#39;t impressed.

LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Although crowded all the time! The staff is amazing!!! The bar staff there rivals mixologist in NYC! Colin, Nadeem and Stacy are absolutely wonderful! I will not go there if I don&#39;t see at least one of them there! They take care of you like family which is what a restaurant experience should feel like. GREAT PLACE!

I decided to choose this spot to enjoy a romantic dinner with my darling. We were expecting to have some bread to start off the night... WRONG. The waitress totally forgot about our bread which creates a tense atmosphere between myself and my lady. She really likes the bread. Aside from that, the food was decent. Although my burger tasted slightly burnt. Next time I&#39;m planning to impress my lady on a nice dinner date, this definitely will not be the place I choose.

I&#39;ve been here a few times. Everytime I come here for dinner, there&#39;s ALWAYS a wait for a table. The entrees come in a large serving dish. <br>For dessert, I recommend the s&#39;mores pie...it&#39;s really delish :-)

The service here is okay. Our waitress kept disappearing and barely ever checked in to see how we were doing. When we arrived, it was late so there wasn&#39;t much of a crowd. However, there was a 10 minute wait because none of the tables were clean. We ordered the Tomato Basil Pasta and when it arrived, it was hard and crunchy. It obviously wasn&#39;t made fresh even the the menu says, &#34;light and fresh.&#34; When it arrived the second time it was cooked all the way through. Although, this wasn&#39;t the best experience,  I still have had some great meals here.

Today was the worst service I have ever experienced at a Cheesecake Factory restaurant. I went in for lunch at 2 pm and was seated right away. The server was prompt in the beginning by bringing us our beverages and placing our orders within minutes of us sitting. Sadly it went all down hill from there, we received our appetizer before we received our bread. Then we waited over 50 mins and never received our entrees. Our server went MIA after telling us our meals were being plated, which was 30 mins ago. We had to ask several servers to bring the manager. The manager was not helpful, he had no idea what was going on and gave us no explanation of what the hold up was. He asked us if we wanted to box our meals and we said no we do not want to wait any longer. We received our check for the drinks and app. Upon further investigation on the receipt, we noticed the server never even inputted 2 of our meals and only ordered one meal. This was the worst experience and will not be visiting again. We went into the restaurant hungry and left hangry.

The sound of the restaurant is deafening. The kitchen is to close to the patrons and the tables are so close you could hear every word in their conversations. The staff was pleasant but the wait for food was long. I suppose this is part of the MALL experience. Poor service and loud plates and cutlery being dropped into sink. Stay away unless your starving.

Food: the food portions are huge! There is nothing bad on the menu<br><br>Service: the staff is slow and forgetful. And very pushy on dessert<br><br>Atmosphere: LOUD. Unless you are in a booth you can heat the conversation of the table near you<br><br>The hostess does not stick to the order people come in. The hostess seated their &#34;friends&#34; while other people were waiting

This was my 2nd time visiting this particular location. The place is clean and service is outstanding. The fish tacos and pasta dishes are amazing. You can not go wrong here. Parking is bit of a hassle but once you find a spot, all green lights!
We came here and the waiter was very polite, friendly and accommodated us 100%. Customer services excellent. Thank you Kevin!

Normally everything is fine but not tonight 8/15. Server came to the table, didn&#39;t introduce herself. The server brought the bread to the table and asked if we wanted anything to drink and was standing like we were taking too long ( 5 sec ) later. I said could we all have water with a lemon. She left and I said to my wife and mother- in- law. Maybe it&#39;s Sunday so attention to detail isn&#39;t important. Annoyed! Down hill from there. My check was the best part of the night because I could leave....
It&#39;s $11.50 for a &#39;Titos on the rocks&#39; here....just sayin. I always enjoy CF but how does this franchise justify that price? The drink was literally a splash of vodka.

Rather familiar with this location.  Yes, sometimes the service is slow.  Yes, sometimes they screw up orders.  However, any time they messed up an order, they fixed it if we asked about it.  We special order for two people in our party, and 9 times out of 10, they get it right, and they fix it the other time. <br>I really like the chicken dishes and the sides - the sides seem especially fresh.  The steaks can be hit or miss sometimes, I&#39;d recommend a steakhouse if you want steak.  The french fries are very good, wonder if they are twice-cooked like they are supposed to be.<br>Not being math-challenged, if they recommend a tip based on tax included, we cleverly can figure out the amount for tax not included.  Not being time-challenged, we don&#39;t go when it is really crowded - that means we rarely if ever go in December because, heck, it&#39;s a mall, people!  If we have to get a beeper, we go elsewhere.<br>I really like their Skinny menu, especially the Skinny alcoholic beverages with calorie counts.  They are fine with substitution or changes.<br>Yes, I do agree that sometimes their hosts and/or hostesses get distracted, but I&#39;ve never seen the worst ones again.  We do see some turnaround with the wait staff, but the best ones do seem to stay.<br>We do like the huge menu, we do like the food, but yeah, don&#39;t visit if it is really crowded unless you want to get hammered so don&#39;t care about the noise.

They have good food, but are over priced in my opinion. Went in for dinner for two, and we each had a cocktail and the bill was over 100$. Service left much to be desired as well. Our waiter took almost 20 minutes when we asked for the check and even longer to come check and see if we needed refills.

All I have to say is oy. Where to begin. My coworker and I thought that the Cheesecake Factory would be a great place to conduct a business meeting, boy were we wrong. We decided to head to this location around 3pm, right after the lunch rush and before dinner service. We walked in and asked the hostess for a table for 2. Immediately we received a look and an attitude - how dare we interrupt her personal conversation with her fellow coworkers. With a sneer, she took us to the smallest two top table, when every other table/booth were open in the restaurant (we were also carrying large bags and backpacks). It took over 10 minutes for anyone to greet us and when we ordered drinks and an appetizer, we could sense the server was disappointed with our order. Since my coworker and I are both in the food business, we know how hospitality should be and we made sure to take really good care of the server. While our server was tending to another table, I asked a fellow server for 2 glasses of water- the response? &#34;She will get it for you&#34;. Really? What happened to team work and helping out your fellow coworkers to ensure great hospitality for your patrons? We really didn&#39;t ask for much, but boy was this experience just miserable. To top it all off, I accidentally left a bag with my purchases at the restaurant. I called about 2 hours after i left to ask if they found a Gap Bag. The manager quickly told me no bag was found and he would call me back if they found it. I heard nothing and called back the next day, asking about the bag, and then again was told no bag was returned. Really?????? Did the bag grow legs and just walked away? So not only did I waste my money on terrible service and mediocre food, but my purchases are lost and Cheesecake made zero of an effort to help find my bag. Save yourself some money and energy and don&#39;t bother dealing with this establishment. Hopefully the management and servers can turn their frowns upside down and treat patrons properly.

I&#39;ve eaten at Cheesecake Factory locations a few times and have generally enjoyed the experience. Today was an exception. After my 2 daughters and I waited about 30 minutes for a table, we ordered 2 appetizers and lunch entrees. After 30 minutes our appetizers  had not arrived. One finally arrived followed 15 minutes later by the second. 2 minutes later our entrees arrived and one was wrong. When I asked if I had someone else&#39;s meal or a mistake had been made in my order, the waiter checked his notes and said I had ordered what he delivered...which I know was incorrect. I ate what he brought because we had already been in the restaurant for an hour and a half. There are many other places to eat in this mall and doubt I will never eat in this Cheesecake Factory again.
Management allows cold food to be served to tables . The compensation  to customer is an apology and the serving a replacement dish at the proper temperature. &#34; cold mash potatoes &#34;

My friend &amp; I have been to the Cheesecake Factory in both Shorthills Mall, NJ &amp; Menlo Park Mall, NJ so many times we&#39;ve lost count. The last time was this April.<br>The menu is extensive. The bar service &amp; table service has always been consistent along with the very long wait times. <br>These 2 Cheesecake Factory&#39;s make the best lemon-drop martini I&#39;ve been able to find in the Tri-State area. I also like their frozen Georgia Peach &amp; Peach Bellini drinks. (If you can make it early to their Happy Hour &amp; get a small table by the bar I recommend it.)<br>In an effort to make this review as brief as possible, I can tell you that the Fried Macaroni &amp; Cheeseballs appetizer is our favorite. And I&#39;ve always liked the following dishes: Chicken &amp; Biscuits with extra gravy (always tender &amp; savory), Steak Diane minus the peppercorns (usually tender with a nice glaze,)  BBQ Chicken Pizza &amp; Roasted Pear &amp; Blue Cheese Flatbread minus the arugula shrubbery. <br>I never liked the Factory Burrito or the Bang Bang Shrimp &amp; Chicken at all! The burrito was tasteless, hard &amp; dry and the bang bang shrimp &amp; chicken were both tough &amp; very dry. <br>Caveat :  Cheesecake Factory in Newport Mall Jersey City, to be avoided. Service there was terrible &amp; the food quality was not consistent with other Cheesecake Factorys in NJ.
We had the Ahi Tuna Salad. Very good and very tasty. Our server Joey was awesome.

Typical Cheesecake Factory. The food is nothing extraordinary and the menu is about 30 pages long. The issue with that is the meals are inconsistent and there&#39;s no &#34;go to&#34; meal. I tend to stick to the skinnylicious menu here because their regular portions are huge. <br><br>The service here was pretty good considering we had a large party (20+). We made a reservation day of and they were able to accommodate. Food came out relatively quickly.

Wait is always a killer...but if the mall is open you can shop around with the buzzer they give you.  We had the sliders and potato skin apps pretty good, tots were a little over fried for my taste.  The waiter started off great and then got less attentive as the dinner went on.  I waited ten minutes for more water.  The floor is super slippery in the bar area as my husbands chair kept sliding around during our whole meal.  We are waiting now for our cheesecake going on ten minutes.  I&#39;ll take a pic lol so will be be back yeah, maybe in 5 or 6 months def not in the near future

Well we had to wait for a table, but considering it was a friday night the wait wasnt half bad. The last time i came to a cheesecake factory I was left super disappointed but they totally made up for it. The food. The service. The drinks. On point. I ordered the pineapple mojito and it was heavenly. For appetizers we had crab cakes and they were a bit heavy handed on the mayo but I like that so I enjoyed them. My entree was the chicken madeira and I loved it. I practically finished the entire meal. The mashed potatoes were SO good. I didnt order any desert. I knew I wouldnt eat it, but its the cheesecake factory,  so im assuming with all confidence that you cant go wrong with cheesecake. Our server was really nice and super attentive. My water cup was NEVER empty and he checked him often enough with us. I really liked him. Over all a good experience in the chain restaurante department.

Many people go here, but this was my first time. Very good location in the mall. Once you enter the mall your immediately at Cheesecake Factory. So I live local and had planned a Valentine&#39;s Day date at Cheesecake Factory. I searched up recommended restaurants in the Short Hills Mall. Cheesecake Factory and California Pizza Kitchen came up. I chose Cheesecake Factory and am very happy I did. I highly recommend itIt always has somewhat of a long wait, around 20 minutes but that was fine because we just walked around for those twenty minutes. After we got our table everything went great drinks came quick, waiter excellent and very nice. We both ordered burgers and they came out. Very big portions. My date ate 5 bites while I ate the whole thing. It was a very smooth dinner. Great conversation, great table. The food also came out much quicker than expected. The dessert there is fantastic. Upon entering I immediately noticed the Celebration Cake. I knew from the start I needed that. Again, my date ate 3 bites and I ate the rest. Paying the check was relatively easy using the cake pay app which I highly recommend This location in the mall is perfect because you can walk while waiting and walk when your done. Highly recommend it especially for an informal date!!

My first experience at Cheesecake Factory! The expectation might have been high, but the food is really just okay. The place is packed so i guess it&#39;s good for the business. We were really happy though they kept our credit card after us forgetting about it.

Waited at the cheesecake factory take-out area for 32 minutes. I contacted several employees - none of whom could assist me --- I was told that the job to take a take-out order and ring someone up was delegated to one individual who couldn&#39;t be found. I ended up leaving. This was at 12:30 PM today.

Don&#39;t. Just don&#39;t. Crowded, loud mess. Entrees came ten minutes apart. Mine didn&#39;t come at all. Manager was summoned and said that a waiter took my entree and gave it to another table!!!! Dish finally came and the potatoes were stone cold. OMG.

I LOVE cheese cake factory! While other moms may take their children to Mickey Ds for a treat, my mom loved to take me to the cheesecake factory growing up. We always got the same thing, shrimp angel hair pasta, and because it comes in a huge portion, we would split it, but not before indulging in the warm fluffy bread they serve before the meal comes! <br><br>After walking back and forth in the short hills mall, we headed over here for some dinner and loved everything. My only complaint is the fish tacos which were not that great. Our waitress was efficient and nice! I would definitely be coming back here the next time I decide to go window shopping in this 5th avenue mall!

I come here often- usually enjoyable lunch. Today my friend and I ordered burgers and fries . We were specific about how we each like our burgers cooked.
