When our meals were brought to the table , both of our burgers were way over cooked and both of our fries were cold. A gentleman came to our table, I assume was the Manager. We nicely said how our food was not cooked as we ordered it. He took our fries, no apology ( how hard is it to cook a burger?); and returned with hot fries when we were halfway done eating. We understand it wasn&#39;t our servers fault and left a nice tip- but a gesture of apology would have been appreciated - maybe coffee on the house. This was my second time having lunch here this week and my meal Monday was very good. Today&#39;s chef was a disappointment .

We had the Mac n cheese appetizer and chicken teriyaki, delicious. <br>Mac n cheese was creamy with cruncy shell and marinara. <br>Chicken Teriyaki was incredible with enough to share for two people followed by banana cream cheesecake.

This place is awesome.  They have a huge menu and there are so many things I want to try but I&#39;m stuck in a rut.  I always go for the lunch size salads (either the cobb or luau).  The portions are huge!  The staff is super friendly.  I used to meet my sister here weekly and I miss it so much.<br><br>I would recommend this place to anyone as they have all types of food. It&#39;s always packed but you never really have to wait to long,

If you&#39;ve been to one cheese cake you&#39;ve been to then all.<br><br>The service was good. Brought everything out hot and quick. Waters refilled as needed. They had the soccer game on, which was nice. If you&#39;re in the mood for the cheese cake factory, head here.

This is my 1st time coming to The Cheesecake Factory and it was a great experience. The hostesses we warm and friendly. They greeted us immediately. No awkward &#34;stand there in silence&#34; moment. The wait was short for a Saturday night. We were seated before our quoted time (15 minutes). Our server Jarid was fast friendly and attentive. Our food and drinks came quickly and delicious. Will definitely be back!

Tuna tartar is supposed to be accompanied by avocado. Avocado is not supposed to be accompanied by tuna. I ordered the ahi tartar and made sure to tell the waitress every time they give me no tuna and too much avocado. I watched her write it down. When it came out, it actually appeared as if there was even less tuna than normal. I immediately asked for a manager and when he came over he managed to try and explain to me that unfortunately &#34;it&#39;s measured out in the morning and I can&#39;t do anything about this&#34;. I asked him to take it back and to please just hurry my food up. I will NOT be back here and I will no longer recommend this place to people, and I am someone who came frequently (4x a month) NO MORE !

Came here around 2:30pm on a Sunday and there was no wait for 2 people. We were seated right away, which is great because we are used to waiting 30+ minutes at other Cheesecake Factory locations. There seems to be a longer wait for larger parties.<br><br>Our waitress was chatty but friendly, a little slow on the refills but that&#39;s ok. I ordered my favorite Chicken Bellagio - prepared to perfection but was not as hot as I would&#39;ve liked. The boyfriend had his usual crab wontons - this one was made juuust right. <br><br>Things they could work on: <br><br>The bread. Waaay too toasted and not warm enough. It felt like we were biting into croutons! <br><br>Silverware. Lots of suspicious water stains. At least, I want to believe they were just water stains. I asked our waitress for a cleaner butter knife and received an equally dirty one.<br><br>Otherwise a pretty solid Cheesecake Factory. Will come back again.

What has the Cheesecake factory done to my beloved veggie burger? They are now using WHITE PASTA as a filler in the burger. The taste is somewhat similar, but the consistency is different. The problem with using the pasta is that they didn&#39;t list it as an ingredient on the menu! The manager tried to tell me that pasta is indeed an ingredient and when I showed him the menu, he admitted they were rolling out a new menu in a week and trying something new. I am so disappointed that a company&#39;s bottom line is more important than customer satisfaction! As another diner commented, this location is  &#34;The McDonald&#39;s of Short Hills.&#34;

Always eat here and usually always have great service. I recently visited and had to wait for the first time but only 10 mins. Got sat and server came right away and took our drink orders and brought bread and than ordered. Food came very fast and server came at least 4 times to check on us. Foods always good here. Will be here again soon and for happy hour.

Let me start off by saying I came here yesterday to celebrate my birthday. I had to wait over 2 hrs to get a table for 12 which is completely unacceptable. Then I had one of the managers tell me at least 15 times that the table is almost done and they will be leaving soon. After about 10<br>mins arguing with him I insist he walk over to the table and see what&#39;s really going on. Told me the table was empty (no food, no drinks) and they had already paid their bill and they were basically talking the night away. Common courtesy, when the restaurant is busy and your done eating drinking and you paid your bill, please leave and don&#39;t waste time. Once that was settled, he sends over the busser to wipe down the tables and reset them. Once that was done, we were directed to the back of the restaurant in a private and enclosed area away from everyone. First thing I notice before I sat down was the utensils plates and napkins were not properly placed on the tables, they were scattered everywhere. Our server then comes over and introduces himself to us. Order our drinks and brings over 2 baskets of bread for a table of 12. Since we didn&#39;t order appetizers we munched on atleast 5 baskets of bread before we ordered our entrees. 15-20 mins later it&#39;s already 10:45pm when our food comes to us and we basically didn&#39;t enjoy the meal as we hoped we would. I barely ate my food that I had to pack it to go because of how late it got. The staff then came over and sang happy birthday to me which was a nice touch to ending the night. I would give this place a 1 star but I gave it a two just to be nice. Won&#39;t be coming back here on a Friday night ever again!

This was a first time experience for myself, having never been to the cheesecake factory, have to say it was satisfying. Not fantastic, not bad at all.<br><br>A busy friday night, service was normal. Our waitress attended to my needs as well as my gf&#39;s and was very polite with us, cant really say anything bad about service other than being sat very close in between two couples which was kinda annoying<br><br>Food came out and for the most part was on point. Ordered the fettechini alfredo, fries, and strawberry cheesecake. You&#39;ll find the pasta is better at olive garden to be honest, the pasta was just soggy, maybe not cooked completely, but it wasnt as good as other restaurants. However as for the other two, the food was really good and filling.
This is a nice place for a group to meet with a variety of dishes to please all.  Either before or after dinner there is a bar area to relax and talk.

It&#39;s decent for a chain but it&#39;s always so crowded and I find the service to be spotty. However, if you sit at the bar area during their happy hour the service is much better and they have a half price menu which is pretty good.

I like to visit here when I am staying at the Hilton across the street.  I&#39;ve only eaten at the bar and never sat down inside the restaurant.  The bartenders are always friendly, service is always quick and their food is usually consistent as a chain.<br><br>If I had to be picky about anything at this restaurant is that when I was in the takeout area, I overheard one of the employees loudly complaining about customers.  She didn&#39;t realize that I was there and was just venting but should probably be more mindful next time.

One star reduction since they no longer have my shrimp and grits!! And they ran out of brown bread when we were there on Tuesday night.  <br><br>I am happy they are keeping their small plate menu items so will most likely come back for that.  And of course, pasta da vinci, it&#39;s their version of Milanese sauce but much better!!<br>I like the bar area... Faster service since it is close to the kitchen, bar and registers.

I&#39;ll never go back. If I ever go with a group bigger than two I wait entirely too long to be seated.  I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve ever been greated by a host with a smile, everyone there always seems to have an attitude. Always have to wait forever for the server to come to the table. Service is always slow. Sometimes you get bread, sometimes you don&#39;t. The portions are big and the food looks good on the plate and it tastes good. Can&#39;t complain much about the food but the staff needs to be better trained.

I&#39;m not big on eating at chain restaurants, but, I love the Cheesecake Factory.  Kids roadhouse sliders are my kids favorite burgers (I&#39;m always stealing bites...they are really good) appetizers are always good..especially Calamari  (another favorite of my kids, Asian lettuce tacos, corn tamale cakes, avocado egg rolls...all great...my wife ( also a food snob who doesn&#39;t like chains) always gets the tuna tataki salad, which she loves...I love the fish tacos, hut, I&#39;ve really never had anything bad here.
I love the Cheesecake Factory but this location offers poor service and inconsistent food prep quality.

I&#39;ve been to multiple Cheesecake Factory locations before and I&#39;m just disappointed at this locations service. I went there today for lunch with my girlfriend and we waited about 10-12 minutes before being greeted by our waitress. We ordered drinks (never got them). I ordered the spaghetti and meatball dish (I don&#39;t know how you can mess up such a simple dish) and my pasta was under cooked (not the end of the world) but my meat balls came out frozen. I advised our waitress of the situation and she goes, &#34;oh they&#39;re frozen?&#34; THATS IT. No apology (which isn&#39;t her fault because she didn&#39;t actually make the dish). She then comes back and advised us that the meal was going to be removed from the bill and the manager should have come over to talk to us about the situation. We then waited another 10 minutes for the bill and no manager ever showed up to apologize. Truly disappointed in the locations service. Most likely will not be returning to this location.

My sister and I come to this cheesecake factory all the time and we have never had a bad experience! Tonight in particular, we stopped here to have a nice dinner together and the waitress we had kept making rude comments to us about what we were eating. We ordered an appetizer and when we were finished, another waitress took it away and our entees came out shortly after. Our waitress came over, and asked if our food came out before our appetizer, (she saw us eating the appetizer prior) we said someone took it away because it was finished and she proceeded to comment &#34;Oh you finished those already?&#34; and my sister and i just looked at each other and she proceeded to say &#34;Oh oh so they&#39;re ALREADY gone, gotcha.&#34; From this point, we felt judged. When my sister ordered her entree, (she orders the same dish each time and has never had any issues) the waitress blantly said to her &#34;why would you want that, it&#39;s bland&#34; this made my sister feel uncomfortable and we were hesitant to order any dessert in fear that we&#39;d be judged again. We weren&#39;t pleased with our experience tonight, and might need to stick with the Rockaway location from now on. (Our waitress was Melissa)

The worst Cheesecake factory that I&#39;ve been too. Since we live close by we&#39;ve frequented this Cheesecake Factory many times. The service is just bad. Waiters might be polite but they and the kitchen staff have got to get their sh*t together. On one occasion my wife&#39;s food came to us 45minutes later than my dish and it was room temperature and seemed as if they forgot to put seasoning on it. The management apologized and gave us a free cheesecake, but we&#39;d much rather just have a good dining experience. Next time we&#39;re here my dish is still not ready a half an hour after my wife&#39;s dish arrived. I didn&#39;t want to eat anymore because the whole point of dining out is to eat together. Anyway I told  the waitress to cancel my order. She said it&#39;ll be ready in a few minutes, but by that point I just didn&#39;t want it anymore. I feel bad for the management of this place ,because I see them going from the reception area to the kitchen and back, an they seem stressed all the time. I personally think from my experience that the staff is subpar in terms of service. Some workers are great I know, but overall steer clear of this Cheesecake Factory. It gives a very bad impression to this franchise. Mind you, me and my wife have been to several Cheesecake Factories in New York, New Jersey, Florida and California. Again this place has been far below in terms of service and food preparation. One more note. Cheesecake is supposed to be served cool, not room temperature. If you notice at this location they always are opening the refrigerated area where the cheesecakes are kept. Just go and watch. We&#39;ve had cheesecake served to us on 3 occasions that was room temperature. Nasty. i hate leaving negative feedback, because we love the Cheesecake Factory, just not this location. Bad.

I have no idea wth happend with the Cheesecake Factory tonight but it was a real disaster. To start things off when we got in the door we were initially given a 20 min wait time, real wait time 1 hour. My mother at one point when we were waiting had asked for a glass of water and it took me on line at the take out counter for 30 mins to be able to get that for her. I had even asked one of the staff members for the water and had nastily been told to wait on line. I&#39;m not asking for cheesecake just water... Calm down.   When we finally got to our table the utensils were dirty wth? Our server was a nice girl but her head really wasn&#39;t in it! First she forgot the wine we ordered and it took 3 times back to the kitchen to get my meal right. Mind you when it did get to the table my parents were done with the meals they had so I just had enough time to grab a bite or two and get the hell out of there. It wasn&#39;t anything weirdly complicated either, just laziness. Beyond that the food was bland and really not worth the  80 bucks they squeezed out of us. <br><br>Not going back.<br><br>Oh.. Also... They need to have a more proactive policy on screaming toddlers. These kids had managed to scream throughout the entire meal and it gave me a throbbing headache. As a server or staff member doesn&#39;t it ever occur to you that this may be really uncomfortable for the other guests to have to listen to?

This is definitely my ultimate favorite chain!<br>I used to go here since I was young to the Long Island Westbury location. I used to beg my parents to take me there when I was a teenager ... always delicious with good service. <br><br>The factory nachos or buffalo blasts are the best for appetizer ... the bread is delicious ... I have tried so many different entree&#39;s and they all have been amazing however my ultimate favorite is Chicken Madeira and Moroccan Chicken ( I ask for the mash instead of rice tho ... yum yum). Drinks are so yummy as well and can&#39;t forget dessert!!!<br><br>Overall I have been to so many different locations numerous amounts of times and love it there all the time !!!! Only downside is sometimes the wait is a little long ... but they say good things come to those who wait ... and it&#39;s definitely worth it !
No one is in the restaurant but we still wait for service for 20mins at 12pm........ So bad never come to this one again

Sadly, after having to attend a birthday dinner here, I definitely won&#39;t be coming back. The service really got all of us thinking that clearly they don&#39;t care much about customer service. 25 minutes after we ordered our food, our waitress comes to tell me that they are out of the steak tacos which I had ordered. I chose the Kobe style burger, which was a huge mistake. I ordered it medium rare and got a hard, chewy and gray colored burger.  at this point, I couldn&#39;t tell if it was really Kobe beef.. It took the waitress another 20 mins before we got the food. Then another 15 minutes to bring us ketchup. To top it all off, no one offered to fill our waters and sodas throughout dinner.

Pretty typical Cheesecake Factory experience.  Service was pretty good.  Bummer they ran out of Dulce de Leche cheesecake and so we had to opt for another selection but overall a good experience.<br><br>Side note:  The amount of birthday celebrations were crazy. I swear it was like 8 or more sing along Birthday chants.  Wow.

Ok- do not like writing this review. This has been my go- to restaurant to meet friends for lunch since it opened. After today, crossed off our list. My friend ordered a cheeseburger with sautéed onions and mushrooms. It was not cooked the way she ordered it and, instead of sautéing the mushrooms and onions the chef grilled them- thereby burning them. We asked for the Manager, who never came. My Chinese chicken salad was your basic bag of salad ( too much lettuce) not enough chicken- it was hard to find; and I can&#39;t believe there was a whole chicken breast there. My friend had to ask 3 people for catsup and it took so long to come she had pretty much finished . Last note- our bill came , we paid and we did not receive the 48 cents change we were due. My friend said it&#39;s CF policy to round up or down. If this is true- it&#39;s awful! Last note- I used to come here so often many of the servers recognized me and we would exchange hellos. Completely new staff-not very customer friendly- maybe some training would be a good mgmt idea.

Maybe the cheesecake is good here but the dinners are very disappointing. We had a couple drinks in the bar while we waited for a table and noticed that the drinks didn&#39;t have prices on the menu.  the wine did, the beer did, the food did, but no drink prices... which we found to be a little odd. When we asked how much things were they said it depends anywhere from 7 to $8 and up to $13.  I ended up ordering a skinny Margarita and it was 10.50 but no one could tell me what the price of it was  before I ordered it.  I don&#39;t think that&#39;s good practice to not put the prices of drinks on the menu and the servers and the bartenders didn&#39;t even really seem to know what the prices were until they rang it up. Then we got our table<br> and I ordered the Almond crusted salmon and kale salad and the reason I ordered this salad was because it had a lot of things in it that I like such as avocado, brussels sprouts and kale. when the salad came out it was just a big pile of kale with some arugula and a piece of salmon on it so I asked the server what happened to all the other things that are listed in it so she brought it back to the kitchen and 20 minutes later brought out that same salad with more kale and some pieces of avocado on it so I just gave up and ate it but they really didn&#39;t seem to have any kind of quality assurance nor did they seem to care.  Tables to the left and tight of us were also having isses and sending things back.  the couple next to us had such problems with their food they sent it back and then one had their food 1 didn&#39;t for at least 45 minutes.  The person with the food tried to wait for the other person to get their food which I&#39;m sure the first person&#39;s food was cold by the time the second person&#39;s food came out 45 minutes later and when it did come back they rejected it and sent it back again.  All this time the waitress never came to check on them.. and then they ended up dining and dashing and suddenly  the waitress appeared and took off running after them!  another person next to us left their whole meal on their plate, no one seemed concerned to ask if something was wrong with it.  it seems like this place is really badly run and worse yet, no one seems to care...

This is a neat place to have a nice meal whether it is a casual dinner or a special occasion. They have a pretty big menu with lots of options to choose from. Came here with family and was not disappointed at all. It was a birthday dinner so the wait staff sang a bday song while bringing the cake with a candle on it which was nice of them to do. The food, the drinks, and the service were great

I often meet friends here for lunch and we usually have salads.  I get the Asian Chicken Salad, which has a plum dressing that is delicious.  Pretzel crusted chicken appetizer is amazing as is the fried zucchini.  Interestingly, the desserts aren&#39;t that good.  The chocolate cake is good but it is so rich that you can&#39;t even eat the whole piece ( which is huge).  The scary part is the number of calories in some of their items. The salads are near 600 calories and a slice of cheesecake is over 1000 calories!!!   Wait staff is usually attentive and frequently refill sodas and ice teas.  Prices are good.  Ambience is very nice.<br>Please don&#39;t review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you&#39;re connected in any way to the owner or employee

I should start by saying I usually love the Cheesecake Factory. My best friend came all the way from Virginia to New Jersey for my birthday and we chose to go to the Cheesecake Factory. We got there and they said it was a 20 min wait for 2 people. At least 20 minutes go by and we go to check how much longer only to find out that the wait is going to be at least another 20 min. When we eventually sit down we order our food right away. When we got our appetizers we asked for a dipping sauce it did not get it until we were completely down with the appetizers. Then I am told that they are all out of the Mac and cheese burger that I had been looking forward to all week. When I got my plain burger that I ordered medium, it was bleeding and raw. By the time my burger came back out it was soggy and watery. This was a devastating experience.

One of my favorite restaurants in Jersey it never disappoints, Yes the menu is big and Yes it is more pricey than other restaurants in the area but it is worth it!!!!!!!!!  The service is all ways right on top of it,  are waiter never let are glasses run low with diet soda or water. I still am having dreams about my salad when that happens I know it was good.

I&#39;m not the biggest fan of chain restaurants, however when my Canadian friends came to visit, it was very high on their list of places to go. Why? I couldn&#39;t tell you, except they were obsessed. On their last night here, we went to the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>After we were seated the waitress, not so nicely introduced herself, following it up with telling us that the restaurant closed at 10 - it was 8:30. While I thought it was a little unprofessional and rude, I ignored it. <br><br>We were waiting for the forth member of our party - which we had told both the hostess as we were seated and the waitress when she came for our drinks orders. She seemed very annoyed that she had to wait, and disappeared... not to the point of we could not see her, she walked past us plenty of times, but she ignored us until SHE was ready. <br><br>While she did seem very familiar with the menu, she did not seem to want to answer any questions. Thankfully a different server delivered our food. Of course, as it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory, my Canadian friends want cheescake (I had tried to take them to Juniors, but they weren&#39;t interested). My Canadians friends and my boyfriend all ordered cheesecake, but as the only New Yorker in the world who doesn&#39;t like Cheesecake, I ordered the Apple Crisp. Well, as the waitress had not written down away of the desserts we ordered, she brought me the Apple Strudel cheesecake. When we mentioned it was the wrong item, she took the dish back, but not before we heard her say &#34;Bitch.&#34; <br><br>My Canadian friends were very upset and had the manager come over - who was very understanding. However, I don&#39;t think a server should have that kind of attitude - at least not in the dining room. Like I said before, I&#39;m not a fan of chains, but I will definitely be staying away from this particular location.

worst experience ever. my blood was boiling. ordered 2 slices of cheesecake (which is already ready) and it took 20 minutes for them to bag it bc employees were too busy on their phones and talkin to friends and countin money on the counter where my dessert is placed. will not b goin back
had the loaded baked potato bites. so good!!!

The place always is crowded. Waiters are short handed. After waiting a long while waiter came by. Very rushed, he had lots to do. Salad was awful. Lettuce looked like it had been sitting out for a long time. All browned at the edges and dehydrated. The main course came. Not much better. Meat was cold and had little taste. I was trying to the waiters attention for another drink, it was not until I was done with my meal that he came by. Lots better places to eat at short hill mall.

I wrote a fairly negative review when this CCF opened up in 2011.  However, we hung in and so did they.  Service got better and we probably averaged two visits a week since then. We generally time our visits in the late afternoon on weekdays to avoid waiting and, while spotty, overall it was good enough to keep us coming.<br><br>That said, we have seen a considerable deterioration of both service and food quality over the last six months.  While there are some great waiters and waitresses, there is a lot of standing around and talking to each other when the restaurant is not busy and seeming overwhelmed when it is.  Either way, no one checks and refills drinks or comes around to see if everything is OK.  People walk around but still ignore customers.<br><br>We put up with this because we loved the food, but almost every time we have visited this restaurant over the last two months something has been wrong with one of our meals (cold fries, cold mashed potatoes, mayonnaise when we asked for dry, etc..) such that one of us ate while the other waited for the correct food.  One visit, it took so long to get the correct meal that I ate dessert with my wife and took home my main course when it finally arrived.  We have also noticed great variation in portion sizes, things generally getting smaller then occasionally huge again.  Cake is most noticeable in the variation.  It also takes a long time to get food, even when the restaurant isn&#39;t busy.<br><br>The last straw was Wednesday.  We were seated immediately.  The waitress was friendly but overwhelmed.  My wife&#39;s fries came out cold. And my meat loaf came with a few drips of gravy.  My wife got her new fries.  I asked for more gravy.  We did not see our waitress again for 10 or 15 minutes.  I never got gravy.  We had to eventually stop another waitress to ask for our drinks to be refilled.  We were so frustrated by the end of the night that even my wife, who cannot get enough of CCF agreed we were going back to other restaurants.<br><br>Noticed lots of managers in the store CCF must know,they have a problem.  Doesn&#39;t seem to be working.

Awesome happy hour deals - drinks for $5.50 from 4-6pm in the bar area. Love the strawberry shortcake dessert! One of the best ever made with scones/biscuits and lots of vanilla ice cream and strawberries. Their beef sliders and guacamole are both pretty good too. Great service if you sit at the bar - friendly, attentive and efficient.
I love the new location! However the staff can be unfriendly at times.. Avocado egg rolls never fail! It&#39;s a nice place to eat after a day of shopping at the Short Hills Mall.

After promising myself i would never return, I got inspired to come back but this time for takeout. My friend and i waited 45 minutes before mutually agreeing to leave. The waiter was extremely rude once he learned we were taking everything to go. Worst than any other time i have been there.
Extremely good resturant. Always busy and really good cheesecake. Really attentive people. The downfall is the business.

Usually order takeout. You call, someone picks up and puts you on hold... You wait and wait and wait. Finally, you hang up.  Then you call the reservation desk, explain that no one is taking orders, they take your order and walk it to the to go counter.  Need a better takeout/to go system!

I was slightly reluctant on eating at the Cheese Cake Factory because One of the guest in my party has severe food allergies which makes dining out extremely difficult especially since it&#39;s a child &amp; I didn&#39;t want to single them out ... I went in, asked to speak with the manager (as I always do) &amp; was seated... When she came over i expressed my concerns &amp; I have to say she went up &amp; beyond to accommodate us &amp; was totally grateful &amp; surprised because of poor past experiences at other food chains... I will definitely return with confidence in knowing my concerns where just as important to them

Had a great experience here for lunch yesterday.  I did not know that CCF had a happy hour menu and was kindly informed by my server Holly (who was amaze); This is typically not the case in the service industry where the service provider&#39;s wages are based of &#34;commission&#34; of sales.  Because of Holly&#39;s upfront honesty, attentive service ( she even struck up conversation about the book I was reading) and customer first mentality I ended up leaving her a 35% tip.  I would give CCF five stars but the host was a bitch and they put giant (five inch plus) sized pieces for chicken on my nachos that needed to be cut with a knife and it was soo much trouble that I took them home!
Trying to order to go and no one will pick up the phone.  Pretty unprofessional.
Wow food was just nasty service was good and fast our waiter was very nice but the food was just nasty I guess the Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t what it use to be..

Ate here twice. Food was ok, hair in my food once... 2nd time the waiter was training another waiter. I guess there weren&#39;t enough people working. Took forever to get my food even for utensils. Asked for extra dressing for my salad.... Didn&#39;t get it until I was practically done eating

I had not been to Cheesecake Factory in a long time mostly because it is not close.  In my recent visit I was pleasantly surprised.  While the food may not be gourmet it was fresh and very tasty.   We will go again. The fresh made guacomole was outstanding.  I also recommend the tex mex rolls.  Obviously ending with excellent cheesecake. Good food and large servings are a good combination.

If you&#39;ve been to one, you haven&#39;t been to them all.  Even though the menu is basically the same at every CCF, the quality of the food and service may vary.  That being said, the food here was very good, came out hot, and tasted fresh.  In fact, my burger (Smokehouse BBQ) happened to be very good and was cooked to a perfect medium.  <br><br>The service was solid, but nothing to write home about.  Lunch specials are reasonably priced.  I&#39;ll be back next time I&#39;m at the Short Hills Mall.

I love the Cheesecake Factory.  I think the food is generally very good, the desserts are great, and the service is usually more than satisfactory.  However, I was not overly pleased with this particular location.  It seems smaller than most, which is fine, but will undoubtedly lead to long waits during peak times.  I came for dinner with a friend on a Wednesday evening, and we were seated right away.  Our waitress did not appear for several minutes, and then it took some time to receive our drinks and bread.  We could not find her to order for a time that seemed too long for our liking.  I ordered a tomato, basil and cheese pizza, and my friend ordered the chicken parmigiana sandwich.  We both were very happy with our meals.  The food was great, as always.  We then had to wait again for to-go boxes and the check for quite some time.  It was becoming annoying.<br><br>I think this Cheesecake Factory location will be very successful, as the Short Hills Mall was slightly in need of another dining spot.  I think the food is great, but the service seemed to need improvement.  Hopefully over time, this will get better.  I think I will stick to the Menlo Park location.

I really enjoy the IDEA of the Cheesecake Factory, and their exasperatingly huge menu...<br>Each time we pay them a visit, I secretly fantasize that all the delicious menu items are lovingly handcrafted by five-star Michelin chefs who are simply waiting for each order to come to them.<br>Usually, there is something or another that occurs at TCF that brings me plummeting back to earth. Take for example yesterday. My family and I went for a late lunch and were promptly seated. We ordered the cheeseburger sliders for our child and kale salad &amp; Vietnamese style fresh rolls for me and my husband got the Chicken &amp; Biscuits.<br>When my child&#39;s order arrived, my husband took a test bite and found a looong red hair embedded in his bite. We informed the waitress, who without a word brought back the offending plate to the kitchen and several minutes later brought a freshly cooked order of new sliders that were delicious AND hair-free.<br>My salad and rolls were as good and fresh as always, and Hubby&#39;s chicken and biscuits were fantastic.<br>When we got our bill, we saw the child&#39;s slider order was removed, which was completely the appropriate thing to do, and we added the amount towards the waitress&#39;s tip.<br>TCF is great in theory if you don&#39;t really pontificate about all the moving parts that it takes to make it operate. Just enjoy it for what it is and keep an eye open for the occasional stray hair.

One of my favorite locations. Service is great. Food is always good. Pasta dishes and miso salmon are my top picks. I had the bbq ranch chicken salad w/the buttermilk pepper dressing. it was decent. nothing too spectacular.
We always have the pot stickers, wings, and ahi carpaccio for our appetizers, all of which were wonderful.  Great menu choices for everyone.

The food was great as always and the service was spectacular! This location is especially gorgeous and well maintained! It was definitely hard to decide but if you&#39;re looking for a good appetizer, I recommend the factory nachos! I&#39;m coming back for sure!

I used to love coming here with the spacious tables for larger groups, great kids&#39; menu and good food.  Everything about our experience there tonight was miserable.  I expected the one hour wait.  What drove us crazy was that we waited an hour for a table for five only to sit at a table meant for 4.  The waiter took very long to come over.  We started by ordering just drinks and an appetizer.  We asked for bread twice before it came.  Since we waited awhile before the waiter came over to get the rest of our order I thought we wouldn&#39;t be rushed with our food.  Well, the appetizer didn&#39;t come until right before our main meals so we had no room for any food on the tiny table.  They wouldn&#39;t clear away any dishes.  Our waiter was getting annoyed and made no apologies for the slow service or for forgetting everything.  We called him over because we were missing one entree.  He again was annoyed and apparently didn&#39;t notice a meal missing because he asked us what else we needed.  We pointed out that we had no main meal and asked a second time for some Parmesan for my son&#39;s cold pasta.  When the missing burger came, there were no fries.   We kept trying to order refills on drinks but he would disappear before we could ask.  We couldn&#39;t even finish a sentence before he would leave the table.  We waited another 20 minutes after dinner was done to get the check.  I took my kids and left my husband at the table to pay.  We were hoping that would be a hint.  Apparently not. We have no desire to return ever again.  We were so turned off!

Let me start off by saying that I love Cheesecake Factory food. Their Pasta da Vinci and salads are what keep me coming back. Cheesecake Factory is like BJ&#39;s/TGIF/Applebee&#39;s - a place you avoid like the plague unless your friend is throwing their birthday dinner there. Why? Because you&#39;ll wait forever for a table, then wait forever for your waiter, wait for your food and so forth. Dining becomes a long drawn out experience peppered with frustration, self-questioning and muttered threats of going home and Yelping.<br><br>I understand that these types of places are almost always busy and Sunday lunchtime is no exception. However our bread basket arrived 20+ minutes after our waitress asked us if we&#39;d like some and by a completely different waiter. The bf&#39;s soda had to wait 30 minutes to get refilled (also by a different waiter). Are you serious? Where did our server disappear to? I was not offered fresh parmesan for my pasta and um hello.. my middle name is &#34;More Cheese Please!&#34;<br><br>Food is always consistent and service is consistently lacking. No thanks.

This location isn&#39;t one of the better ones I&#39;ve been too.  The service is OK, not great.  Our server, Larry is always very cordial and does a great job with our orders.  He carries himself with much class and is always polite and respectful.  I feel he deserves to work at a much better restaurant.  This location is beneath him.  The food is not up to the standard of what The Cheesesteak Factory is known for.  My appetizer wasn&#39;t good.  And my Mexican Omelette dish had dry, hard pork ends instead of pork chunks thats supposed to be in it.  I&#39;ve been to this location numerous times for brunch, and they are getting lazy with their food presentation.  And they always want to seat us in a corner in the back near the kitchen or the register.  Today we went to the Woodbridge location, and everything was so much better.  Skip the Short Hills&#39; location.

Second time eating here, second time I get a hair in my food! Ugh!!!!!!!! Manager comes back with a replacement item for my hairy food. I had to tell him to just take it off the bill. On the second occasion I was with my kids having brunch and again a hair in my toast. When I told the waiter he got the manager who came out with replacement toast. So again I had to ask him to just take the food and take off my bill. I told him this was the second time and he just said , &#34;oh sorry,they all wear head nets&#34;. Seriously!  So so disappointing!

Cheesecake Factory short hills mall NJ<br><br>We&#39;ve been to a lot of different cheesecake factories and it ranks as one of our favorite restaurants, usually with an understandable wait, but have never experienced a restaurant with this degree of disorder, rudeness and unprofessionalism.  We arrived to an hour wait which for CF on a Saturday we expected and accepted.  Since we had gone out of our way and were a distance from home this late we decided to hope for a high top table that might open up or a spot at the bar. Decent human decency would dictate when you are done eating and see others waiting that you might get up and make room.  Not this clientele.  Seems delighted to watch us all wait and watch. When one couple got up at the bar and we prepared to sit they waved another African-American couple over who took our seats and and had the nerve to say &#34;sorry, wrong color&#34;.  Wow.  In today&#39;s world?  Finally a high top opened up and we sat down. The other high tops around us were wiped down and orders taken while we waited over 30&#34;!!  Asked three times and were told they were too busy and would help soon.  The kind African-American couple next to us who had sat down 10&#34; after even pointed it out to their waitress and still nothing. The bus boy went out of his way to avoid clearing our table and that of another family.  The waiter was forced to clear the other non-AA table a few down. Finally, our table was cleared by our clearly unhappy waitress. Half the bread finally arrived without butter. No drinks. No order.  Finally 20&#34; later our disgruntled waitress took our order. 20&#34; later cold food arrived and that was it.  Are as fast as we could. No dessert was offered. We paid and left our worst CF experience ever in over 40 different locations. Not even a close second. Clearly management tolerates poor attitudes, slow service, and behavior that has no place in a respected chain or today&#39;s society. Very disappointed by our experience. But for all those those others also disappointed by your experience at this short hills location, fear not.  There is not another cheesecake in the USA this disappointing.  Try another. Sad and shame on anyone who treats anyone different based on sex or race in today&#39;s society especially in this selfish, narcissistic world.  Usually CF is a pleasant escape but not here.  We won&#39;t be back to this location

I&#39;m giving this five stars because I really like Cheesecake Factory (they are somehow able to mass produce tasty foods of a ridiculous variety) and this location is often quite free as opposed to other NJ locations.

The service level on SUNDAY 3/22/15 was horrific. My friend and I arrived at 8:45pm, we were seated at 8:55p. After waiting at the table for 9 minutes, my friend asked the hostess who was our server. We then saw and heard several servers arguing about who didn&#39;t  want to take us. Finally, after another 4 minutes our server appears. He just asks what would you guys like. Normally, Im asked would I like to start off with drinks or appetizers. Great servers even tell you the specials. I felt very dissatisfied as a customer and will never eat at CHEESECAKE FACTORY in Short Hills ever again. I will tell all my friends and family, this is a place that doesn&#39;t redpect you, so dont spend your money there. Corporate will definitely be notified!!
I would give 0 stars if I could! Pathetic!! Called right before leaving to get there, they told me that they had a lot of empty seating when I got there we had to wait for 35-45 mins.

The mac and cheese burger. Lemon Raspberry Cheese Cake. WOW! I am even more so impressed with the service. Everyone I was with was stunned. The setting. The noise level was perfect. I highly recommend The Cheese Cake factory. I will be coming back to try every cheesecake!
I have only been here once where there wasn&#39;t a wait. However, I&#39;ve experienced this at most of their locations. The food is still great though! The cheesecake is awesome.

Order all screwed up. Sent my burger to wrong table. Rude manager.  I watched the four other people in my group eat their meals. Then they watched me eat. Great celebration. Management&#39;s idea of compensation: a free slice of cheesecake. Not in a rush to go back.

I went to Short Hills Mall to go to an Apple Store but the wait for my appointment was 1.5 hours long.  My husband and I decided that we can go to Cheesecake Factory and eat in. It was this past Monday night, Dec 5th and the place barely had any people and we got seated immediately.  My 3 year old had chicken fingers and mashed potato (chicken was a bit over cooked and chewy); Hubby had grilled salmon with mashed potato and broccoli crown (salmon a bit undercooked, no seasoning; broccoli well cooked and fresh); I had Steak Hibachi with mashed potatoes and mushroom. (That one was good and flavorful but the server did not bring the vegetable tempura that was supposed to come with it.) When I asked for it, she didn&#39;t even know if it came with it and later on said that she will ask the cook to make it. No surprise, we were already done eating and she came with a small sausedish with greasy fried beans??? That didn&#39;t at all resemble like a tempura.  We asked for two different kinds of tea, when my husband and I tasted each other&#39;s tea, they were the same. I asked if it&#39;s the green tea iced tea for me, she said &#34;Yes.&#34;  We also ordered a dish which is grilled chicken and vegetables &#34;ToGo&#34; THE SAME TIME we placed our seat in order...IT WAS NOT ready for SUCH A LONG TIME. The buswoman had cleared our table and I went to the ladies room, my three year old was already miserable, NO ONE CAME. The server told us our take out order was ready before we paid, but the stores were already closing. Apple texted me so many times for my appointment but I couldn&#39;t make it because OUR FOOD took so long. The mall closed. I kept asking for a manager but no manager showed.  A receptionist came and told me that the server is standing by the kitchen waiting for my food (2 hours?). I paid. I paid my tip because I didn&#39;t want bad karma on me.... but by far, THE WORST CHEESECAKE FACTORY I&#39;ve ever been.

It&#39;s a fancy diner, if a diner could ever be fancy...<br>I come here for their happy hour.  $5 LITS, mojitos, margaritas and a couple other cocktails.  They have several appetizers for only $5.  I love the breaded Mac n cheese balls, although they are clearly frozen and then fried.  They&#39;re a guilty pleasure!  I am also a fan of the crab goat cheese wontons.  Its a very generous portion for $5.  I also ordered the ahi tar tar.  It was OK, as expected since Cheesecake Factory is neither a seafood nor sushi restaurant.

I&#39;ve been a very big fan of the cheesecake factory for nearly a decade, if not more. I usually go to the one in Menlo Park mall, but I was in the Short Hills mall area, and was in the mood for cheesecake factory!  Server was exceptionally great for a Saturday night being seated at 7:40pm. Granted, I&#39;m still sitting, waiting for the check, but I haven&#39;t had to wait too long for anything (my bf and I took awhile to figure out what we wanted). Buffalo blasts came out incredibly salty. Not only was the chicken and cheese filling seasoned (not complaining! It was great!) but the flour was heavily salted; adding the Buffalo sauce and blue cheese became very hard to do with all the existing salt. <br>Then we get our main courses: shrimp and sausage pasta, and the Cajun jambalaya pasta with shrimp. The shrimp and sausage pasta dishes was out of this world good! Pasta was a tad bit too al dente for the bf, but it was spot on for me. The Cajun jambalaya, on the other hand, was severely overcooked, had NO sauce/taste, and absolutely not to my recollection, not even close. But I was so hungry, I ate a bunch of it, while waiting for the waiter to pass by. He ended up coming back with extra sauce from the manager of the kitchen and it was everything the dish was missing. My poor waiter, Joseph, was so apologetic when it wasn&#39;t even his fault I felt bad.... I would give this review 5 stars just for Joseph, if I could, but unfortunately the food was sorely substandard. Consistency across meals and dishes in regards to salt and degree of spice is so lacking here.
If I could give zero stars I would. Terrible terrible take out service managers have no control of their staff.<br><br>Took me 30 minutes just to get a hold of someone to take my order.

The food is delicious at The Cheesecake Factory in Short Hills Mall. The major con is that the service is very, very slow, and inattentive. The restaurant is extremely busy and noisy. There are other wonderful restaurants that have the key combination of delicious food and fantastic service.

You know what you are going to get here, production line food that is bland and has no real thought in it.<br><br>My advice is to go somewhere that care about the taste of the food that they are serving.<br><br>At being said. They had a great selection for kids.

This is one of my favorite restaurants of all time. Yes, the hour-long waits are ridiculous sometimes (the trick is to get in right as they open) but the food and service makes up for any inconvenience waiting might cost you. I always come here to celebrate special events because the menu is so large that there really is something for everyone. I haven&#39;t had a single dish that I dislike. I especially like the roll sampler for appetizer and the chicken bellagio. Their herb crusted salmon filet is also very tender (can you describe fish as tender?) and flavorful. You can&#39;t go wrong with the burgers. Calamari is perfect. I can get over my lactose intolerance for their cheesecakes. Be aware that the portion sizes are astronomical, so don&#39;t hesitate to get the smaller size if given the option.

ALWAYS leave something out of my to go order. Not necessarily a full item but an ingredient or two in a salad will always be missing or they&#39;ll give me bread and butter when I said no and leave it out when I say yes. Just very inconsistent.
Can&#39;t beat the happy hour specials here - half off appetizers and drinks from 4-6pm!  Love coming here after a long day at work.
Love love this Cheesecake Factory compared to the ones I been too stay away from Ridge hill cheese factory terrible service

Service was terrible. Went there on a Monday afternoon 230 and didn&#39;t leave until 4pm!!!! Everything took forever!!!! No apologies, no check in to see how we were doing. Also the restaurant itself was very hot it had to be at least 80 degrees in there.  I sadly will not go back to this one. I&#39;ll drive further to Menlo Park

Delicious foods but it takes forever. Be prepared to spend 1.5 hours here, 30min eating and 1 hour just waiting for your order to be taken, the food to be prepared &amp; served to you, and your check to come.<br><br>I like that they have a &#39;healthy&#39; menu, because all the normal appetizers are fried or made with a ton of mayo/cheese. <br><br>Portions are large, cheesecake is plentiful. Lots of screaming babies &amp; children.
Instead of eating at Cheesecake Factory, stay home and eat a few tablespoons of salt. You&#39;ll save money and won&#39;t be consuming as much sodium as most of the entrees.

Although I generally find chain restaurant food to be decent but underwhelming, the Cheesecake Factory seems to be the exception. I&#39;ve been to several locations over the years, and only today I realized that I&#39;ve never had a bad meal there. Two of my usuals are the Thai Lettuce Wraps (when I want something a little lighter) and the Stuffed Chicken Tortillas (those corn cakes on the side are ah-mazing). Today my boss treated the staff to lunch for Admin. Professional&#39;s Day, and everyone loved their meals. We shared several appetizers: Avocado Egg Rolls (always a favorite; these are ridiculously good), Buffalo Blasts (really good; the portion is huge), the Crab &amp; Artichoke Dip (okay but not great; the flavor was a little lacking), and the Fried Mac n Cheese Balls (I mean it&#39;s fried mac n cheese. what&#39;s not to love?) For my meal, I had the fish tacos with the tempura style fish. I&#39;ve had plenty of fish tacos in my day, and these are pretty exceptional. The cabbage slaw takes it over the top with the right amount of acidity and crunch. The rice and beans on the side were better than average as well. I ordered my cheesecake to go because I was beyond stuffed at this point. I had the Lemon Raspberry Cream Cheesecake, and I&#39;d definitely recommend it (as long as you&#39;re not one of those if it&#39;s not chocolate it&#39;s not dessert kind of people). It was the perfect balance of sweet and tart, and the ladyfingers added an extra textural element which I thoroughly enjoyed. All in all, an amazing lunch and the leftovers made for a delicious dinner.

Went for dinner on a Thursday night it was pretty busy we were told that it was about a 15min wait we patiently sat and waited. After about 20 min the buzzer went off we were escorted to a tight table between other patrons we nicely asked for a booth so we could have our conversation in private they obliged and put us in a booth they gave us our menus and left, after 5 min a manger or hostess came over and told us that we could not sit there because this table was promised to someone else???? After being sat we were now told we had to wait an additional 20min if we wanted a booth! Really we left and will never be back to a Cheesecake Factory restaurant ever again!!!

What can I say? I absolutely love this place. I mean, it&#39;s a chain, right? How different can they be? Well, not so different afterall.  But the location is good, right at the mall, and opposite one of my favorite hotels(Hilton), so all in all I&#39;d say it&#39;s a good place. Been here twice already, and I&#39;m sure that it&#39;s not my last!
For its Happy Hour and the chicken potstickers on that menu - a cheap, cheerful and tasty time !

Finally! Cheesecake Factory has arrived at the Short Hills Mall, what took you so long? You can&#39;t beat the menu, but you will need to be patient.  Just  like every other Cheesecake Factory, you will need to wait, and that is just life at the Cheesecake Factory. Sade our server was happy, attentive and quite knowledgeable.  The meal of course was terrific.  They offer complimentary valet service when validated so take advantage of it.

I cannot believe I am writing such a bad review for this restaurant as it used to be one of my favorites. I recently brought a good friend of mine here since it was his first time and I was super excited to introduce him to all the wonderful options. He ordered a Mai Thai drink to start off and noticed it was way too sweet compared to my passionfruit mojito. While drinking it, he noticed something floating inside and there was a mosquito at the bottom of his drink! We called the waitress and asked to talk to the manager immediately. The manager came out and apologized and said he wouldn&#39;t charge us for the drink and if he wanted another but it was such a disgusting experience he just asked for water. He already drank almost half of his drink! I was really surprised that the only thing the manager offered was another drink. At this point, we were turned off but already ordered our food. The waitress messed my order up giving me more food for a higher price and my friend went back there to talk to the manager again about his unpleasant experience.  The manager offered to take two items off the receipt but it was the drink and my miscalculated meal. The people next to us were watching in dismay and said they would never go there again and my friend told me that was his last time as well. I am disappointed for such a great brand name restaurant to be empathetic and mindful to the customer experience and cleanliness. I would not go there again and advise you to do the same.

The waiter Issac was AMAZING ! He gets 5 stars all on his own. The food we needed salt and pepper it was very bland. I got the combo plate with shrimp scampi and herb salmon. It&#39;s not mentioned that with the shrimp scampi there&#39;s no angel hair noodles when it&#39;s on the combo plate. But, my complaint would be the manager Paul. We were told after the fact that the bar had closed and that&#39;s when the services ended. So we requested to speak to the manager -- no harm done to ask, the worst he could say was no and we would understand -- but no, instead he made a comment &#34; We wouldn&#39;t just sale you a bottle even if the bar was open&#34; -- we wanted champagne for my bestfriend- it&#39;s her 26th birthday. We were very offended when he said &#34;bottle&#34; as if we wanted Ciroc or any other type of alcohol. Immediately we just said ok thank you and now I&#39;m here making a review. I would not recommend this place to anyone and I will call and make a complaint about the manager.

The food is consistent with the rest of the chain, predictable and plentiful. The wait staff seems to be in perpetual training mode and not at all clear about menu choices and preparation- yes it&#39;s a very large menu. What frosts me the most is that after 3 visits it&#39;s been the same, wait time 15-20 minutes stated by hostess, actually 35-40 minutes. Complaint to manager was met with an apology and excuse that hostess staff was understaffed, does that make sense??????

Everything is pleasantly perfect, expect the fact that it is sooooo crowded... We arrived at 6 pm, and have our dinner at 8.30 pm.... However, the dishes are amazing that I believe I can forgive that....LOL
Terrible experience - poor food quality, high price, slow service. Returned dish twice. Manager never came.

I was there on a Sunday night. Almost 6:00PM. The place was packed. I was trying to place a carry out order. I was standing by the counter for almost ten minutes. No one would like to come over to check on me. A waitress saw me at least six times without saying a word. And a waiter passed a order to the customer in front of me and run away right away. He looked like he was afraid to talk to me. In this situation I left without any other choice.

Great service and great food. Awesome atmosphere, not too dark not too bright. Service was great and I&#39;d like to point out outstanding service of a young shnazzy good looking, sexy beast of a busboy Sam F who attended to my frequent request :)

Ordered a medium well burger and got it extra well done (ie burnt and bitter from the char) and the patty falling apart. Sent it back for a medium and it was still more than well done and still bitter. I was just craving a decent burger after wasting an hour at lunch I didn&#39;t get one.

The first time I came here with my father, I thought the service was just okay. They were friendly, but the service lagged. We never got our complimentary bread, which is supposed to come with every meal at Cheescake. Food was superb though. <br><br>Now the second time I came with my father, we had an amazing waitress who catered to our every need. She was kind and attentive and it&#39;s unfortunate I was not able to catch her name. Food was great as always. But then, I forgot the necklace I purchased earlier in the day at the mall and didn&#39;t realize until 12am during closing hours. I decided to give them a call anyway and luckily was able to get through. They were able to find my necklace, kept it safe after 10+ hours of not realizing I lost it thanks to Stephanie.  Even though the food is great, the service is as well. That&#39;s why they get the 5 stars!
This was our second visit to this Cheesecake Factory.  The service as very slow. They got my order wrong, and the coffee was so horrible that it needed two sugars to make it drinkable.
What can I say? Its the cheesecake factory. Awesome service and great cheesecake and of course large portions.. So come hungry or be ready to take left-overs home to enjoy later..
Not a fan!  Have tried twice and both times our food was not that good.  Really wanted a better place to eat at the mall.  Also, it really took way too long to get served.
Happy Hour rocks at this place! Service and food were very good. Portions are quite large, so come hungry.
Large portions of horrid, processed food served in a loud, crowded space inside a shopping mall. Basically, the perfect vision of Hell.

The worst experience ever I was there yestrday with my wife and friends we got a table in about 10 min service was decent the waitress recommended there special Thai crusted salmon so I decided to try it    What a big mistake when I got home I had a special night of throwing up and stomach pain all night never again will I be eating in Cheesecake Factory

We had a lunchtime party of 9.  Called at 11:00 that morning to have them prepare an adequate table. We arrived at 12:05 and the table was not ready.  Once seated it took over 15 min for a waiter to come &amp; place bread &amp; take our orders. We advised we are on an hour lunch break.  Our orders were salads and chicken lettuce wraps.  Our food did not come to our table until 60 minutes had gone by.  At that point, we had to hand our dishes back to the waiter and request all 8 dishes (which should have been 9) be taken back to the kitchen and wrapped to go.  One of our party&#39;s order was inadvertently not placed by the waiter so she walked away hungry with no lunch.  The waiter did politely fess up &amp; apologize and so, we understand that kinda stuff can happen with such a large group (really?) at lunchtime.  But also,  the food was mediocre at best.  Salads are simply romaine &amp; iceberg with a few tiny strips of cold wet chicken.  Salad dressing was a heavy, sweet, thick consistency akin to a no name brand store bought bottled dressing.  No one in our party will visit this chain again.

Usually I&#39;m a big Cheesecake Factory fan, like the Willowbrook Mall location 1000 times better! I&#39;ve tried the Shorts Hills Mall location several times and each time they have been worse. At first i thought because they just opened up and getting used to things, but nope. There service and food have gone totally down hill. The last time i went with my wife and son and both me and my wife got sick! Would NOT recommend!

It took 20 minutes just to get someone on the phone so I can place my order, then they said to come in 20 minutes to pick it up. When I was there, it took an extra 30 minutes just to bag it and find which one was mine. I double checked with one of the staff to make sure my order was right before leaving and she  didn&#39;t look but insisted that it was. When I left, i was sadly disappointed to see that it was not what I ordered.

I did not like the Cheesecake Factory and don&#39;t understand what attracts so many to wait so long for so much food with so little taste. Maybe it is the &#34;family friendly&#34; atmosphere where all the children appear to be having sugar rushes while their adult minders ignore their banging on the tables with their utensils and screaming at each other. Service is inconsistent. The food was fair but you can do a little better for a little less at a local diner.

It serves the purpose.  Good consistent food.  The portions are large and the prices are good.  I&#39;ve been twice.  Once for dinner in the summer and once for lunch in the fall.  It&#39;s just what I want when I am meeting a girl friend for lunch at the mall.  The drinks and dessert look great but I generally don&#39;t have either at lunch.  The bread could use some improvement.

Reason for the one star -- the service and management is HORRIBLE! Just had one if the worst dining experiences and it wasn&#39;t because of the food. 20 minutes without a greeting, 15 minutes to get drinks, waiter not knowing the menu... And worst... Obviously looking around and trying to get someone&#39;s attention and not one person lifted an eyelash. Where was the manager or staff? I wouldn&#39;t be this disappointed if a similar situation hadn&#39;t occurred 2 weeks prior. I will not be going back. My advice- hire accountable staff, train them properly and be an aware and proactive manager. The level of service had decreased significantly since it opened at short hills. This is coming from someone who was in the service industry for years, I have beyond patience and understanding, so you can tell how upsetting this dining experience has made me.

Short Hills Mall location - Food was good but I agree with the other reviews on here and on Facebook ... the service is terrible.  Our waiter took forever to greet us, after served us he never came back to check on us, he finally came with the check and took it while he had a pile of dirty dishes from another table in his hands.  If you&#39;re looking for decent food and don&#39;t care about slow/absent service than the Cheese Cake Factory at Short Hills is for you.

All Hope Abandon, Ye Who Enter Here...<br><br>We found ourselves at this Cheesecake Factory on a recent Sunday afternoon, at the suggestion of some friends who desperately wanted to share with us the fatty, poor quality food and poor service for which this restaurant excels. As others have pointed out, this place is always packed and the customer is the one that suffers.<br><br>We were seated promptly, for which I give the hostess credit, but then it felt like forever before a) we could order b) we got our drinks c) we got our meals. It must have been an hour between the initial hello from our waiter (who, strangely was handling tables on two sides of the restaurant!) to actually being able to eat anything. <br><br>And what a disappointment when the food finally did arrive. Look, I know it&#39;s chain food and I shouldn&#39;t have expected much. I figured I&#39;d play it safe with a salad, and it was a good choice - except the salad was the size of a large mixing bowl. That&#39;s not healthy. <br><br>One of our friends mistakenly ordered the chicken and biscuits, and it was the single most disgusting plate I&#39;ve ever seen. Frozen chicken breast swallowed-up by mountains of mashed potatoes and soggy, rubbery biscuits. Ick!<br><br>Somehow, we accomplished to leave a little room for dessert. Each ordered a different cheesecake, hoping to share a bite or two. Lo and behold, only two arrived. It took a good 10 minutes to flag down our waiter to inform him the food had gone missing. He apologized profusely, and was very apologetic about it, but it took another 10 minutes before another server brought over the missing items. How can that happen? All they needed to do was cut two slices of cake and bring them to our table. It&#39;s a 30-second process. And the name of the restaurant would make you think they have the whole &#34;serving cheesecake&#34; thing down to a science.<br><br>Of course, in the interim, the manager came by to offer a half-hearted &#34;so sorry, we&#39;re really busy&#34; apology and walk away before we could say anything. That was perhaps the most disconcerting part. Rather than make things right, he went through the motions and left before knowing the situation had been remedied. Bad, bad customer service.<br><br>In all honestly, the cheesecake really wasn&#39;t very good. It was obvious it had been made someplace else, put on ice for days, and stored in a very cold refrigerator to prevent spoilage. This wasn&#39;t the kind of cheesecake you can get at Junior&#39;s or any number of places in the NY area famous for that dessert.  And if you can&#39;t get your signature item right, well, you know where this is going...<br><br>By the time we left, a simple afternoon meal had turned into a two hour ordeal. It may not be hell, but it certainly was not a pleasant experience. There&#39;s a very good diner just around the corner. You&#39;d be better served going there instead.

This place is what you&#39;d expect from a typical Cheesecake Factory (or similar) chain. Think-a step above Applebees/Fridays (IMO). This location is always busy and the service is usually fine, nothing spectacular-I&#39;ve worked in restaurants before so I can understand mediocore service during the dinner rush. The menu is absolutely insane (its spiral bound like a book) and I never end up liking what I ordered because there are so many options for meals. The entrees aren&#39;t worth gushing over,  but the avocado spring rolls are a great appetizer and obviously the dessert is where it&#39;s at-you pretty much need to order cheesecake when you&#39;re here. When it comes to CF, keep your expectations medium to low so you are even more satisfied when you&#39;re digging in to your peanut butter choc. cheesecake!

My guest and I were reluctant to wait 1.5 hrs at 7pm on a Thurs. Come on already. Needless to say we decided to head to the bar for a drink. It was mobbed as well. To be expected. When all of a sudden a light came down from above and rows of people began to part as if Moses was in control. There 5 feet ahead was a couple leaving a table that was first come first serve. Like a linebacker I pounced on the table as is it was a quarterback. Success!!!  So the wait was under 3 mins tech but we got lucky. Ok well you get the idea. So when we finally settled in to several looks of jealous couples, we waited and waited finally someone came to take our order, for drinks. Once that was complete, it was time to review the book of food. Nearly the size of a phone book. So much to choose from. Burgers, pasta, chicken, apps, so much to choose from. When we finally received out drinks, which was a while, we finally put in an app order. Nachos with chicken. The chicken didn&#39;t taste fresh. After a couple of tries I picked of the rest of the chips I ate. They were skimpy on the cheese as well. For a meal my guest had the ahi tuna salad which seemed to disappoint. I had the Cuban and I really regretted doing so. It tasted old and non fresh. So as far a meal, even though there is a large selection I have always left CF disappointed until ,that is, dessert. Again you get a separate menu with a laundry list of cheesecakes. Too many to even mention. All tasting better than the other. I opted for the tiramisu ck. I rarely am disappointed with dessert but this ck tasted like freezer burn. Ugh! The entire experience from the service to the quality of food was very frustrating. Although the waiter was nice his absence and prolonged disappearing acts was unacceptable. The food is overpriced. Their cks are their only saving grace and that was a letdown. Would I go back, good question. Be prepared for a long wait all the time.

What kind of company has a name like The Cheesecake Factory and they don&#39;t even make the cheesecake themselves, when the waitress asked me if I liked the cheesecake I asked her if it was fresh, I could tell it wasn&#39;t freshly made but rather a frozen pre made store bought type cheesecake.  She told me they do not make their own cheesecakes.  What a shame!!  They should change their name.  Also  they have an enormous menu but no organic options not even one.  Restaurants lately have been adding organic options to their menus due to the GMO problem in this country with the food.  When or if they offer organic options to their huge menu then I will come back but not until then.

So cheesecake factory the food is always amazing. But omg the service is the worst. We heard severs arguing bc they didnt wanna take us. We were two black men hungry n looking to drink. Now you get y they didnt want us. But the servers arguing  bout taking us were also black . He  came over n said yall ready. He gave  us little to no interaction unless i made eye contact. I was so mad that i still got my snicker cheesecake togo, which was delicious, but would have been to irrate to speak with a manager. People come out bc they have a crap day n when yu paying for something n wanna be tipped on it than take pride.  My friend payed the bill n i told him not to leave anything bc service sucked but good thing we have Hackensack n edison. I went there n there service games is on point.  Only given a three bc food again was good..
I had the Herb Crusted Salmon. It was cooked perfectly with a lemon butter sauce that went well with the asparagus.
You can never go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory! Always a favorite and never disappoints no matter which location I go to.

I love the decor of the place.  Hostess was very friendly.  The front desk seem a little unorganized.  My food was not satisfactory.  I had grill pork chops with mash potatoes and spinach.  My pork chops was ok.  But the mash potatoes had too much pepper in it and the spinach was wilted, not cook leaves of spinach with white spots.  Both sides tasted terrible.  I brought it to my waiter&#39;s attention and they did make another batch of spinach for me to go and it also was not done properly.  The waiter did not ask me if everything was ok or nothing before I left.    I was very disappointed on the service that night.  Next time I will not have dinner.  Just dessert and a drink.
I went to this location for the first time today. The food was very good, the services friendly and fast. The service was much quicker than at the Wayne location although the food is the same.

This was my first time to a Cheesecake Factory.  I thought the food was great! (which gets 5 stars) But the host table, wait service, and manager needs an overhaul.  This restaurant needs to start over on the staff.

I&#39;m gonna go ahead and admit I&#39;m an employee here, but that doesn&#39;t change that I looooove the food here, and knowing the trouble that servers go through to make sure the guests are happy, I doubt you&#39;re gonna get better service many other places. Just know that although we have healthy options on our menu, I don&#39;t think those options are our tastiest. I think the best cheesecake experience will be had when you kinda let yourself go and really indulge. That&#39;s what the huge menu and all our waiter training is all about: giving you that one meal you reeeeaaally really wanted and making sure it&#39;s perfect. If you go in restricting yourself and saying &#34;I can&#39;t eat what I want to,&#34; then you probably won&#39;t end up with the best food we could give you. Above all things, save room for cheesecake :-)

Horrible service, had to eat our appetizers and bread without silverware or napkins after asking for repeatedly.  Waited 20 minutes just to get water and be acknowledged, 50 minutes in, still no food...later talked to the manager about our issues, didn&#39;t even say sorry or do anything to resolve the situation.  Had to flag down other waiters and waitresses to get dessert and our bill paid.  2 hours at the table, rediculous!

As always The Chessecake Factory delivers. Great atmosphere, great menu, great food and always a great time. There is nothing new here from any other location. They use the same great menu (where everything is a specialty) and the staff is fantastic. Yes its in a mall, but thats the only difference to it all. Might make it a bit harder to find parking but otherwise no drawback there. My only complaint is that for a Cheesecake Factory, its a bit small. We&#39;ll definitely be going back as we&#39;re very happy to have one move this close to us. Great addition to the area.

we love cheesecake factory for the menu, and would get this once a week if we werent so frustrated by the management at short hills.  this particular location is very poorly managed.  we&#39;ve gone out as a family several times here and always encounter lackluster service.  dont bother even trying to do takeout at this place.

Can&#39;t wait to check out the new gluten free menu that came out or is coming out. In the meantime, the staff was very helpful.  Service was great.  The place is so loud....but they always are.  BUSY BUSY BUSY, as expected.  If they have a gluten free cheesecake, I&#39;l move in.

I was trying to go to this place for the longest time because it just looks so nice inside. It looks like it would be so upscale, but the prices are totally manageable especially for short hills mall. I like the tomato basil pasta. I love all pasta but I liked the sauce they put on it. I will be going back again to try more stuff out.

Ok, this place takes way to long to get your food. Lines are unbearable and the food is just way too much. Prices are decent but it just isn&#39;t a great place to be. In pretty much every category, there&#39;s a better place around the area.

Food was very good - tomato basil pasta was light as promised and very tasty. The fettuccine Alfredo was also very good. The cheesecake with strawberries - excellent!  Three stars because the service was horrendous !  We came on Monday at 6 pm - the restaurant was 40% full and had ample waitstaff. Yet we waited 10 minutes to be seated in spite of many open tables and once seated waited 10 minutes for a server to take our order.  My dining partner&#39;s order was wrong - he ordered whole wheat pasta and waited 15 minutes for the correct order. We asked for water when seated and finally flagged a bus boy after 20 mins to get a glass of water.  The waitress was polite but invisible. All in all the hostess and servers left the impression that they didn&#39;t want to bother with us.  Very disappointing.

We had an awful experience at this restaurant. My family and I went to celebrate my brother&#39;s birthday and it took about 10 minutes of waiting before we got our drink order, which we then were also able to order our entrees since we had so much time to decide. The server apologized and we let that go since it was busy. However, things went downhill after that. Our bread didn&#39;t come until after our entrees had already arrived. During that time, I watched another couple sit down across from us and get their drinks AND bread faster. My father ordered a salad with his burger and the dressing did not come with the salad, so we asked the server to bring it out and by the time she got it to us, everyone was practically done with their meals. Everything had to asked for twice from this server. She seemed to be more attentive with other tables and I don&#39;t understand why we had to go through so much trouble to get anything from her. In addition to this, when we put in our drink orders, I requested lemon slices with all the waters. The lemon slices also did not come until after we were done with our entrees. It was honestly just not an enjoyable experience and I had never been to a restaurant where I have had to request everything twice (or more) before. I will not be going back to this Cheesecake Factory, as I think the service really needs to be improved on.

I ate at the Short Hills Cheesecake Factory on Aug. 15, 2011.  I wanted to order what they call their specialty drinks.  There were no prices on the menu.  I asked the waitress to check on the price of three different drinks and she came back to me with an answer from the bar that they ranged from $7 to $10.  I told her I did not want to spend $10 and so I needed a definite answer on a pomegranate martini.  I ordered it and she came back and said it was $12. So I just ordered a glass of wine which had the price on the menu.  <br>Why are there no prices on the drink menu? They post food prices, but not drink prices. Is this true in all the Cheesecake Factory restaurants?  Are you deceiving the general public? I will not go back to this restaurant for that reason alone.  In this economy people want to know what they are spending before the bill comes.

Worst. Cheesecake factory. Ever.<br><br>let me start by saying my family is big Cheesecake factory fans, but this place sucks.<br><br>1) The waiter was just bad. So slow we could have cooked the food ourselves. Whenever we asked for something, like the bread which we got after the food arrived (and should we really have to ask for it at all?!), or the beer which we got after the food arrived too...., but didn&#39;t get it, she claimed &#34;it didn&#39;t fit on the tray&#34;. Huh?<br>We waited for the drinks. We waited for the food. We waited for the check. We waited and waited and waited. <br><br>2) French country salad with approximately one beet, one asparagus and one tiny piece of cheese. Where was the erst? Maybe it didn&#39;t fit on the tray...<br><br>3) My 3 year old wanted Mac N cheese from the kids menu. When it arrived the top was kind of congealed. I tested it for heat, and it was luke warm, so my son proceeded to eat, but he ate from the middle and SCREAMED from burning his tongue. Seriously - Microwaved Mac N Cheese for kids? What the...<br>We called the manger over who proceeded to explain in a derogatory manner that when cooking mac N Cheese they boil the pasta and cheese. No shit, of course they do.
